Reviews.Title: “Ideal location, functional and clean.”
Reviews.Author: sbouckley
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this Ibis for 3 nights as I was staying in Amsterdam with friends. The location of this hotel couldn't be better as its a 2 minute walk from Centraal railway station. Check in was efficient and quick but beware the hotel is split between 2 buildings with a bridge link on the 5th floor where you have to change lifts to reach some rooms on the upper floors on the other block. Remember to take the right colour lift! The rooms were small, basic but clean and functional. We had a view over the river and the railway station and noise wasn't intrusive with good soundproofing in the rooms as we were on the 6th floor. Only one slight criticism was the room was very hot and took a combination of open window and rather noisy air con to bring the temperature down to a reasonable level. Breakfast was pricey but pretty good with a large choice of hot and cold items. The hotel also had free wi-fi which was a great bonus. All in all, a comfortable stay and would recommend

Reviews.Title: “Basic, but OK”
Reviews.Author: Stoks
Reviews.Content: Great location, next to the central railway station in downtown Amsterdam. The rooms are very small, certainly by US standards, and so is the bathroom: if you're waist size 40, don't bother because you'll have difficulty getting in and out of the shower... Judging from the menu choices the restaurant cannot really be called a restaurant, serving the occasional pizza, but then, there are a zillion places in the downtown area where you can have anything from a bargain meal to a fancy expensive dinner. Breakfast (self serving) is certainly OK, with a fair choice of hot and cold dishes, although the precooked fried eggs tend to be a bit dry. A nice perk is the free wifi, and that has a decent speed, too: other European hotels easily charge â‚¬ 15! There is no coffee maker in the room and the desk is really tiny. Overall, at around â‚¬ 140 a night including breakfast this is certainly a bargain. Do not expect any luxury, though.

Reviews.Title: “Amsterdam Visit”
Reviews.Author: abcdz353 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Staff very helpful. Good value for price. Next to Amsterdam Central Station. Centrally located, to catch tour buses ,canal cruises and eateries,trams Stayed 2 nights .Got a room on the 8 th floor with a good view across a wide canal and train station. Get your own instant coffee, and ask for a electric kettle.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Value”
Reviews.Author: Grif65
Reviews.Content: Perfect Location. Clean functional rooms. Only problem was keeping the room cool on the west facing side.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location. Next to the main Train Station.”
Reviews.Author: Viviana O
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night and it was very nice. We chose this one because is next to the Station Centraal. The room was nice, it had TV cable, free Wi-Fi and nice view. I would come back to this place. Not for budget travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a stag party”
Reviews.Author: superlav
Reviews.Content: A group of 20 of us stayed here for a stag party in March, and found it ideal for what we needed. Situated right next to the train station, this place could not be easier for a group booking. It can be hard to move a big bunch of lads around, so we decided on this place and it was perfect. Within a few mins of getting off the train from the airport, we were all checked in and ready to roll. The check-in was efficient and without issue. A few minutes walk from everything, or you can hop on a tram right outside the door. The rooms are a little small, but spotlessly clean, exactly what you would expect from an Ibis. After arriving back to the hotel one night a group of us decided to have a few beers from the vending machine in the reception area, the guys on reception were more than happy for us to do this. We even had a speaker and ipod going and they didn't mind at all. Checkout again was a breeze, and for a large group booking in Amsterdam, I can't think of anywhere else I would consider.

Reviews.Title: “Moving beds”
Reviews.Author: Mufassil D Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The beds were wheel mounted and hence were moving easily posing a hazard to fall. Infact my friend's wife did fall during our stay but fortunately wasn't hurt. This can be serious in case of children and elderly. Please take appropriate mitigation measures.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you need and a great location”
Reviews.Author: steen-odense
Reviews.Content: I must say the stay was a pleasant surprise. Ibis is not the first choice that comes to my mind for a city stay. But it worked out fine; the reception was even helpful finding another room since I am kinda allergic to noise; and when I got ill during the stay the gave me a late check-out for free, a service you normally only find at more expensive hotels. The breakfast was all right although nothing special. And location next to the main railway station and the Amsterdam city centre with the charming canals was unbeatable for that price. And free WIFI not to forget!

Reviews.Title: “second stay and enjoy it even better”
Reviews.Author: aigarssm
Reviews.Content: Ibis City Centre Amsterdam hotel is simple, 100% non-smoking and clean! Father more it is located next to Amsterdam main railway station and convinient, if you are need to cathc-up train to some other destinations within Netherlands or neighbour states. So, check-in is smooth and friendly, if you are willing room with the view, ask for rooms at second block with event number, than you will have room wtih the view to the waterfront and newest Asmterdam project -The Eye. But there is also draw-back to those rooms â€“ you a little bit can hear noise of rail, which is some 5 floors down under. Rooms are clean and simple â€“ there are nothing much to do wrong, while there are bed, shower & WC, minisafe (which is great thing) and flat screen tv with wide range of programs. Sleeping quality is good, while bed was not too soft and not too hard, just perfect for quality sleep. I took also breakfast, which (by my big surprise) was rather rich for IBIS hotels! Plus, they do have real coffee!!! This was second stay at IBIS City Centre Amsterdam and I must admit, there will be third too.

Reviews.Title: “Clean & central.”
Reviews.Author: MichelleMGlasgow
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights from 30th March-1st April, we arrived around 9pm and check in was fast and we were given rooms next to each other on a high floor as requested. They do ask for a 50 euro deposit OR a copy of your credit/debit card which is standard in most hotels incase you damage the room. The rooms are pretty small, but have everything you need, although the bathroom is ridiculously small(ie a larger person would have trouble getting dried after a shower/dressed in here)but the shower itself is nice and clean and large enough. Our view from the 5th floor was great, looking onto the bike garage and the canal. We had no problems with train noise, or noise in general at all. The hotel is literally a 5 minute walk from Centraal Station and lots of fast food places, bars and tourist attractions, and about a ten minute walk from Dam Square and nicer pubs and restaurants. The breakfast was included in our booking and it was a lot better than I was expecting, there was a good selection of eggs, sausages, beans, toast, breads, cheeses, cold meats, yogurts, cereal, pastries, basically you won't go hungry! Check out was fast, and they let us keep our suitcases in a seperate locked room until we had to get the train to the airport. Another good point was that they sold cold cans of Heineken in a vending machine on every floor which was ideal for taking back to your room, and cheaper than the bar prices!(3 euros). This hotel is a great base for Amsterdam, within easy reach of all the action, but not in the overly noisy/busy bit.

Reviews.Title: “the best location when staying in the city”
Reviews.Author: karl434
Reviews.Content: rooms are clean, the security is good, safe in the room is free, and its quiet considering its above the railway lines, the price is a little high but worth it as everything is in walking distance and the train station is visible from the windows. dont bother paying for the breakfast, its not up to scratch, just walk across the square and pay half as much for twice the quality!

Reviews.Title: “Tiny, tiny rooms - but clean and otherwise comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: Blurgeshmurg
Reviews.Content: I can't stress enough how small my room was - I had to sit on the toilet at an angle because there was a wall right there! But everything was spotless, and my bed was surprisingly comfortable, so it's a decent budget choice for a solo traveller. Beware of sharing with a friend - even if your room has two beds, there's not enough room to move them apart. The location right next to the train station is a mixed bag. It's a relief that the hotel is so very easy to find, but you have to walk far to get any peace and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location”
Reviews.Author: Gareth M
Reviews.Content: Hi just came back from stag weekend in the Dam and chose this hotel as our base. Very clean, modern hotel, friendly staff with a fantastic location. Only gripe is it was very hot, to the point where I had to go outside to get some fresh air! That hasn't put me off however and would stay there again if I revisit Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Central location but small rooms”
Reviews.Author: Soundpilot
Reviews.Content: I shared this room with two of my friends and it worked well for us. The room was very small, but it was still clean and had 3 single beds which was perfect. The cost was average, but the location was fairly central. Additionally it was super easy to catch a tram to anywhere in the city center. And being right next to the central station allowed us to easily take the train from the airport to the hotel, as well as check out and catch a train out of the city. I suppose it depends on which room you have, but we did not have any problem with noise, despite being located right over the tracks.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, shame about the location”
Reviews.Author: janers88
Reviews.Content: I thought I was being smart by booking a hotel by the train station but little did I know that our room would be built over the actual train tracks. Although the double glazing helped it was still rather noisy. We asked to change rooms but the only triple rooms were in the block over the tracks. If there's only 2 of you, ensure you don't get put in the red tulip tower !! Apart from this, the hotel was ideal - good value, clean, modern and the staff were helpful. I would stay there again as long as I wasn't in the same tower !

Reviews.Title: “ibis centre amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: deLLarte
Reviews.Content: simple hotel with a basic utility.close to anywhere in centrum of amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: amy2011br
Reviews.Content: Ibis Amsterdam Centre its near the main station, near the Tourism office, near market and near Dam Square. The hotel has a good breakfast and the rooms are clean and the staff very nice and helpful

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Used this hotel just for an overnight stay as it was centrally located and convenient for our drop off/ pick up points for our short trip. Reception staff very helpful and even though we arrived at 11.00am, we were able to have the room so we could drop our suitcases off before venturing out into the city. Slightly worried about the location of the room - as the hotel is next to the station, our room literally overlooked the platforms, however it was double glazed, and by the time we returned in the evening, we were so tired we were not disturbed at all by any noise. Breakfast the next day was an all-you-can-eat, help yourself affair, which was possibly not the best value for money but we enjoyed it and the standard of food and especially coffee was very good. Surreal situation for the breakfast room, as it is on the ground floor literally next to the station platforms, so you can sit and eat your meal watching the trains and commuters come and go! We were able to leave our cases in a luggage storage room next to reception free of charge until we left Amsterdam later, so that saved us taking everything with us during the day.

Reviews.Title: “exaclty what I wanted”
Reviews.Author: Cecile C
Reviews.Content: This hotel fits to the IBIS general brand description. You can reach everything you want to see in the city centre from this point, which is a big +. Our room was just above the railway but on the 9th floor so noise very, very limited. My only minus here would be the price for breakfast: 16 euros definitely is too much. Then again, thanks to its location, there are tons of places 5 minute walk away which offer very good breackfast for 5 euros :)

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Louise_bham
Reviews.Content: Location of the hotel is fantastic within walking distance from everything you need!hotel is very clean as were the rooms although the triple rooms were very small and not much room to move around in but adequate for one night!unfortunatly we had the train station right below our window and could hear trains and announcements until 2am in the morning these then started again at around half 5!which isn't fun if your a light sleeper!the location of this hotel however sells it and would definatly stay here again on my next visit!

Reviews.Title: “Never again even in desperation for a nights sleep”
Reviews.Author: hotelinspecytor
Reviews.Content: A chronic hoel shortage left the Ibis for one nights sleep, at the last minute booking. The walls provide music of an unsavourary kind, with an orchastra to blush a Granny,trains that pass by, the noise torturing the brain, air conditioning that is fit for eskimos at hoime in tnheir igloos, take a fur coat and head cap with protective ear muffs, make sure your teeth do not chatter the bathroom that has an odour that requires emptying a can of airfreshner, and a bed that should best not be described. Staff that are indifferent, with a breakfast to match, great for anarexics. Would rather sleep in a hostel than this at last resort. .

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Devvaki
Reviews.Content: This place is right next to the station and is walking distance from Dam Square and the other places. You don't need a cab to go to the red light area or anywhere else. Can't spend time in the hotel because there's nothing to do. But the rooms are nice and worth the money since one saves on travel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & value but noisy if on the train station side”
Reviews.Author: IrishLouise
Reviews.Content: This is exactly what you would expect of an Ibis hotel - good value, basic, clean rooms and a decent (but priceyy at â‚¬16) breakfast. The added extra for this Ibis was its fantastic location right beside central station. UNfortunately this also made for a disadvantage as we could hear the trains from our room. If I go back to Amsterdam, I would stay here but insist on a room at the other side of the hotel away from the noise.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: sandyDublin_ireland
Reviews.Content: stayed here for the second time in February 2012.Great location,clean rooms,friendly staff,it was really cold outside but the rooms were warm.Would definitely recomend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great, would recommend”
Reviews.Author: JO664
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my 4 friends in Jan 2012, great for positioning, friendly staff, clean rooms. You couldn't get closer to central station, if (like we did) you want to be getting off a plane, to your hotel and out in to the Dam then don't stay anywhere else! Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Cost/benefit ratio is optimal.”
Reviews.Author: Alexksandr N
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a couple of days with my wife and was totally satisfied. From the first step - young gentleman called Dion at the reception, who showed an exceptional example of professional skills and hospitality - and up to a final "Good bye, sir", the staff was perfect. Cleanliness, comfort (but note, the rooms are rather small), and location are perfect as well. Cost/benefit ratio is optimal. I will come back.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: McLorie
Reviews.Content: This 3-star hotel is located next to the Central Station, in the very heart of Amsterdam and overlooking the old historical city and is very is easy to reach by train from Schiphol Airport (15 - 30 minutes). The hotel is within walking distance of many of Amsterdam's famous sites. All rooms are well furnished and modernly decorated. Each room has an en-suite bathroom and modern facilities, including a TV and wireless Internet connection. The hotel was very clean and the staff were very friendly and spoke excellent English. The hotel bar was very pleasant and not over expensive. The Hotel itself was not particularly cheap for an IBIS (approx Â£150 a night), but the locality to the centre of town is superb and more than makes up for the price. Although the hotel is located next to the centrail railway station you did not hear any trains at all during the night (although I did spend most of the nights drunk ;0) - When in Amsterdam!!!!)

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel of Amsterdam Centraal”
Reviews.Author: abbey456
Reviews.Content: Its worst Hotel of Amsterdam Central with referance to ROOM SIZE and Per Night Rate compared to other class hotel with same rate This Hotel is not suitable for Family at least Asian Family All Rooms are very small and specially Bathroom is worst as Toilet and bath area are close to close.

Reviews.Title: “Spot on for simplicity and location”
Reviews.Author: JCR1987
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for mate's 40th birthday over the weekend. Room was Â£120 for a triple for 1 night (it worked out cheaper to book direct via the hotel website rather than through booking.com or laterooms.com). Firstly, getting to the hotel couldn't be easier. Fly into Schipol (Amsterdam) airport, get the train from the airport to Amsterdam central train station, turn right out of the main station entrance and your hotel is about 200 yards away opposite a massive bike stand with literally thousands of bikes. Check-in process was relatively simple, although some people do take a ridiculous amount of time just to sort out getting their room key (French people) and they always seem to be in front of me. The room was pretty much what you'd expect for a cheap triple in a chain hotel, clean, relatively small, but had most things you'd expect from a hotel room. The only 2 things I could pick them up on are: 1) No drink making facilities, although I suppose hotels aren't obliged to provide them. It wasn't even something that crossed my mind until someone pointed it out later in the day, so that goes to show how little it really bothered me, however I can see some people would have an issue with it. 2) I had the fold-down bed by the window which was comfortable enough, but right in the middle of the frame on the right hand edge was a metal catch which obviously is used for when the bed is folded up to keep it on the wall. However I think i probably scraped my leg on it about 5 times over the course of the day. It didn't do much damage however it was more annoyance factor than anything else and again and I would have had a real problem with it if it'd ripped my new jeans. As it was, it didn't, but I'm sure someone more petty than myself would find cause to complain about something like this, regardless of any injury or damage sustained. Hotel facilities are pretty decent, a nice little bar downstairs, machines on each floor for drinks and snacks. Even though the hotel is built above the train lines coming in and out of central station, I couldn't hear much going past and it certainly wasn't loud enough to disturb me. That said we were on the 5th floor so i can't vouch for what its like down on floors 1,2 or 3. Staff were very polite and helpful (even when we came bundling in about 5am... i think). Overall, a very good hotel and is definitely where i'd book in if the lads go to Amsterdam again.

Reviews.Title: “small but ok”
Reviews.Author: Pawel_EPWR
Reviews.Content: The location is excellent , next to the Central station and very close ie 5-10 mins walking to Dam square. The hotel room was clean and welcoming. Staff on the reception helped us about everything I needed. Accommodations were very good with an good breakfast buffet. The room was extremely small. Room rates changed almost every day. Breakfast really expensive.

Reviews.Title: “If you want central and clean and nothing else then this is fine”
Reviews.Content: The check in staff are friendly but the lobby has little charm. The rooms are very small which included a micro washroom and very little space to put your luggage or hang your clothes, but here is a safe. The TV is virtually on the ceiling and you can almost shower, brush your teeth and use the toilet at the same time. For me it was very noisy and I was at the front of the hotel. Apparently it was wose at the back. However the bed is comfy and the room was very clean! It is also very close to the station and the vibrant city centre. If you want a clean hotel with a comfy bed near to the 'sights' and a decent continental breakfast then this could be a good choice. This was booked for me as it was close to where I needed to be for business but I would not choose this again! Thats my personal preference it was just not for me.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: dec60
Reviews.Content: very good location about 100 mt. from the train station, Stayed 4 nights over the new year and the fun started at reception with the receptionist. very friendly staff everyone that we met stopped to shake hands and wish us happy new year, it's the small things that make the differance. we had a problem in the lift on one of our nights, and true to their word we became their guests for the night. rooms are very warm and opening the window means that the trains might cause a problem if you are a light sleeper. yhe whole is very clean and well kept.

Reviews.Title: “best location”
Reviews.Author: deeeb
Reviews.Content: best location tight rooms but clean they have a free luggage room to keep ur staff after checking out if u need to store them for a while (very useful to enjoy the rest of the day without carrying ur stuff around)

Reviews.Title: “Really is the Centre of Everything”
Reviews.Author: jazzmate
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights at Amsterdam Central Ibis and found that the hotel is very well located. Close to Damrak, RLD and everything else. Internet is free at the lobby but got some free wifi detected on first day so didnt pay them until second and last day. Extension allowed at 10 Euro per hour. Managed to nego at E50 until 7pm (7 hours). Laundrette available not too far at Damrak (10 minutes walk). Room very well heated and soundproofed. Receptionist were polite and well informed.

Reviews.Title: “Ibis Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Good central location for tourist. Near main train station for those with early trains to take. Nice clean rooms but limit of space. Not a room for those with large or many suitcases as there will be no place left to move about in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Great location if you don't go by car”
Reviews.Author: Sue2France
Reviews.Content: The hotel is great for central location, all main tourist attractions on foot. We were expecting difficulties with our car but it was worse then we feared. The public car park very near to the hotel costs 55e/night. The hotel staff advised us to drive out to a Park & Ride place where the rate was 8e per night.. Although this was easy to get to it was a nightmare. We waited an hour to get a place and the next day when we went to collect the car we were charged 22E as we should have registered to get the special price! Most surprisingly, the hotel staff were not aware of this. The hotel room was small but the bathroom was great. We didn't hear the trains even though the hotel sits over the station.

Reviews.Title: “Location is the plus”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Location of this hotel is fantastic right next to the train station, unfortunatly this is also the bad point with the noise from the trains which you can hear at night when you want to sleep. Room quality is good but basic in line with ibis standards, if you want 5 star then it is not. Also the lack of basic room amenities like a kettle and tea / coffee was suprising. On check out there is a bag storage area however this is very loosly controlled with no receipts or tags when you put bags there or remove them, this concerns me as anyone could effectivly pick up and walk out with someone elses bags. Other than that a hotel i would recomend for those who want a cheap place to stay in the heart of the city centre.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Ibis, Fantastic Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Ibis central location is perfect if you take the train to airport and other locations in Netherlands. The staff are very friendly and helpful. However, when we were visting and staying, only one elevator was working the other elevator was under service for a couple of days.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location but you pay for it! Typical City Centre Chain Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ely_yellow
Reviews.Content: I use this hotel regularly for business trips and very good it is too - staff are very friendly and helpful and always plentiful. Rooms are compact but comfortable and the location is very close to trains and trams. It is pricey but the location is worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, staff, room equipment...”
Reviews.Author: LowFareTaxees
Reviews.Content: We stayed here recently, and got much more than we expected. Located a minute of walking away from Central Station, and two minutes of walking away from the most popular streets and squares in Amsterdam, we couldn't ask for more while our long-weekend visit. I have to praise hotel staff which was very professional and helpful, making our stay comfortable. The room was small but clean and practical, with all the equipment we needed, including baby bed, TV, hairdryer, safe... We were lucky to get very good price of 65â‚¬ per room per night, and that's one more reason we would definitely come back here again.

Reviews.Title: “Usually use Ibis...”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We arrived early... they were gracious and as a room was available let us in early. Thank you very much Ibis. Left luggage room is good but would prefer a bit more security. Bathroom is small (sitting on the look awkward).... everything else was clean and nice as you would expect.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend Visit”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is ideally situated for the Central Railway station and as all trams terminate and depart from here it was absolutely ideal for our purposes. The hotel staff were courteous and friendly and we thoroughly enjoyed our stay. Although the bedroom was a touch on the small side it was always very clean. For a budget hotel we definitely would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, for a few nights”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, right beside central station so great for the airport and transport links to anywhere in Amsterdam. Rooms are small but perfectly functional (with safety box too). If you staying here between flights consider leaving your main luggage in the lockers at the airport to avoid having to carry it around.

Reviews.Title: “poor hotel”
Reviews.Author: nannige
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in the second weekend of December and although the hotel is in a very good central location (very near to Amsterdam central station) the quality of the hotel is basic, the rooms are too little and poorly cleaned. There are better hotels available than this, in Amsterdam, for better price.

Reviews.Title: “I enjoyed my stay here for 3 nights”
Reviews.Author: skivnj
Reviews.Content: At first, I was a bit hesitant on staying here because of the location being right next door to Centraal Station. But, it turned out to be great and so convienent! I was lucky to be given a spacious room as soon as I checked in (early in the morning) with one of the best views of a city I have ever have. I found the beds to be comfortable. The breakfast was alot to choose from and served from early morning until almost noon! Suprisingly I did not hear and noise coming from the train station. I found the staff to be friendly and helpful. The young lady at the front desk on our arrival even gave us a recommendation for getting a cheap sandwich at the train station (rather than buying an overpriced meal at the hotel). There was one staff member at check out at 4 am who was worth avoiding. All in all, it was a good stay here and I would return to this location if I return to Amsterdam. The only complaint that I have is that the room floors were not as clean as I would have liked. Bring light slippers or cheap flip flops if you go.

Reviews.Title: “long queues at frotn desk”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I had to wait 10 - 15 minues every time at front desk; to check in, when my room card stopped working, to ask a question. I did want to use WiFi but couldn't be bothered queueing once again so just left it. You need more staff on the front desk, or make the process faster to check in!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Very good location, complete breakfast, room size, noise insulation and free internet connection were the positive points. Staff was friendly. On the other hand, some towels were stained and their cleanliness could be better.

Reviews.Title: “Central Hotel, but can be noisy !”
Reviews.Author: franzvg Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Very good location, next to the Railway Station, you can walk nearly everywhere, that is the only good thing I can say about the Ibis in Amsterdam. When we arrived, nice friendly reception, given the key, and then had a shock in the allocated room, there was a condom hanging down from the fire alarm in the room, which I found more then disgusting, the chamberperson did NOT do a proper job at all ! then given another room which was ok, be aware, the rooms and bathrooms are very small ! and most have a direct view of the Railway Station, Announcement can be noisy! but closed window cuts most of the noise out. Advice: take your earplugs along as I did, and you are fine. Found the Hotel expensive for such a small room, but brilliant location, ok for 1 or 2 nights, No Longer ! Enjoy Amsterdam !

Reviews.Title: “Not so nice a finish to river cruise.”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The room was too small and the single beds too narrow for a good sleep. There was no visible thermostat to adjust the room temperature as a result had to open window and listen to the train noises all night. The duvet was too thick and hot. Stayed extra night in Amsterdam after AMA Rhine cruise. Sorry to say but the ships cabin was larger than the room and it had an oversize queen bed. Otherwise the hotel was OK,-clean and friendly service and close to old town Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Internet”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: During check inn I was asked to pay for the already prepaid rooms. I refused and told that the rooms were already paid, but I had to pay! During the 45min check-out!!!, the very skilled Ms. Ina found that there was a mistake and I got the money back. Disappointing that I had to waste so much time on issue which should not occur! Good location, good hotel but as businessman who use internet every day, free internet in the rooms has become a benchmark for us. No free internet, no deal. Thanks Martin

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Hotel - Dont stay here!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Janet L
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights last weekend and although the hotel is in a very good central location, be warned of the staff, if they can find any way to charge you for any extras they will and you will need to take out a loan to pay . We have stayed at a lot of hotels for weekends away but will never ever go back to this one, the hotel is basic and the staff are very unfriendly and unwelcoming.

Reviews.Title: “Great Quality Great location”
Reviews.Author: Rach881
Reviews.Content: In November 2011 i stayed for two nights in this hotel. it is really great for looking around amsterdam and is situated right beside the train station. The staff are very friendly, rooms are very clean and you cant hear any noise from the trains. Very good value.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, really great member of staff who saved my day!”
Reviews.Author: sweetchic123
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights last weekend, I have stayed in a few ibis hotels and thought the rooms were better than most other ibis's. Location was really good for exploring and v convenient to the train station. On the last evening and throughout the final day we had in amsterdam (when we should have checked out at 12) I was really ill and the member of staff who my husband spoke to (unfortunately he didn't catch his name and he wasn't there when we left as I wanted to say thanks) let me stay in the room for 5 hours after check out cos i was ill. I was so grateful for this and can't imagine many hotels would let you do this! So if he reads this then thank you !!! I would definitely stay here again for good location at a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Fresh and Friendly”
Reviews.Author: Cybil48
Reviews.Content: We had weekend in Amsterdam in Nov, travelling by ferry and staying one night in the city. To Be honest we werent expecting a decent hotel but were very pleasantly suprised. The rooms were very modern and fresh, the bar area a delight. The breakfast facilities were realy great and loads of choice, again in a very fresh and tastefully decorated area. Also a free luggage store should your ferry leave late , mind check out time isnt till 12 noon iether which is another bonus, Staff very pleasant and helpful

Reviews.Title: “One week in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Very conveniently placed next to the Central Station for City sightseeing and access to trains/trams for trips further afield, this is a clean and comfortable budget hotel with good customer service

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Ideal location to see the major spots in Amsterdam. I would definitely return to this hotel. You can leave your luggage at the hotel after check out time and return to pick them up and walk towards the train station.

Reviews.Title: “Ibis Hotel at Amsterdam Centre”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Very convenient location, just next to the Amsterdam Centraal Station. Clean, comfortable rooms reasonably well sound proofed so little disturbance from the nearby trains. Has a decent breakfast spread.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Ibis, Amsterdam Central - Location, mostly”
Reviews.Author: Mediko A
Reviews.Content: I stayed with the family for one night in Apr 11. The hotel was selected because we need something close to the train station to ease us travel in and out early morning. Aside of the location, the other thing was just mediocre. The receptionist was not very nice - to us and to other guests - rushed and not genuine. The shower drain was clogged, lucky the manager was able to solve the issue finally. It took us a while to get hot water. Compared to what we had in Paris hotel, we certainly was not happy.

Reviews.Title: “Literally on the Station”
Reviews.Author: Samir-Bhuta
Reviews.Content: Stayed there early oct for a night. The hotel is situated right on the station and the airport is about 15 min train ride. Right in the center if town all popular tourist stuff is either walking or a tram ride away. Small rooms but clean and no surprises. Best part is the superb noise control, even being literally on the station,no noise comes in and you can sleep in peace. Breakfast and small restaurant in the hotel. The only problem is No Wifi in the rooms, come on Ibis wake up, free Wifi in the rooms is the way of life for a business hotel, which Ibis is supposed to be.

Reviews.Title: “Best budget 3 star in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: ColesDad1
Reviews.Content: First this hotel is right at central station.Great for catching the trams to see all of amsterdam.Second the price is right for a 3 star hotel with elevators in central amsterdam.Third go left out the hotel and go under the over pass and your right in the jordan.The rooms are small and you might have to open the window for a cool breeze but how often is it that warm in Amsterdan.Ask for a room in the frount building (they are alittle smaller but it will save some elevator and walk time).Clean rooms and hotel!You will not get a better room for this price in the centrum.I almost wish it would not get out,I'd like it not to get too popular.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Ibis, Amsterdam Central”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We found the hotel conveniently situated in the center of Amsterdam. The staff were helpful even though there is only little interaction with them. Rooms were very clean and pleasant, although we found them too hot. The air-conditioning was clearly not working and opening windows is not a very good option due to outside noise. Having said that I would still recommend this hotel to anyone wanting to find themselves very close to the centre of Amsterdam

Reviews.Title: “very good breakfast”
Reviews.Author: lzysd
Reviews.Content: hotel was just ok, but I can't forget the delicious breakfast. Many kind of cheeses, cakes and fresh orange juice..

Reviews.Title: “Nice and clean.”
Reviews.Author: Lovingtrip00
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a good location, very near to the central station! For this location it is a bit noisy if you stay in the three o four floors! Clean and with a good breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient”
Reviews.Author: devansh68
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, right on the central railway station. The windows were sound proof so this was not a problem. Within walking distant to Dam square and also having several tram connections to different parts of the city. Neat clean standard IBIS room. No complains there. Value for money.

Reviews.Title: “My Review”
Reviews.Author: suhailaga1234
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very lose to all major areas in amsterdam. Good on price and value for money, I stayed at this place on a business visit to amsterdam. Cozy rooms and a great place to rest and rejuvenate for the next morning.

Reviews.Title: “Decent central hotel.”
Reviews.Author: nmc08
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for four nights and found it to be a good choice at the budget end of the market. The room was small, but the bed was comfortable enough. They did only provide one square-shaped pillow each, but we didn't find this to be an issue. The bathroom was also very small, and the shower could maybe have been more powerful, but other than that had everything we needed - including hairdryer. Generally we didn't find noise to be a problem, except for the air-conditioning coming on randomly a couple of times early in the morning. Our room overlooked the train station but we had no problems with noise from the trains - maybe because we were up on the seventh floor. We didn't have breakfast in the hotel and didn't have much contact with staff, but the receptionists were friendly enough. They accommodated our request for a late checkout - but they do charge 10 euros for every extra hour. The location of this hotel is ideal - right next to Centraal Station, and very easy to find. It's not luxurious - but in a city with so much poor budget accommodation you could do a lot worse - and we would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “A very central and decent business hotel”
Reviews.Author: Norwegian_Couple25
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a couple of nights on a business visit to Amsterdam. The staff are nice and helpful, and the rooms are nice. The bathroom was maybe a bit tiny, and the pressure in the shower weak, but okay. As is it situated right next to the train station, it is hard to have the window open as you will be awakened by the trains. But this also means you are ideally situated for public transport. The breakfast was very good, and the in-house restaurant was okay given the price. Would easily stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny but very clean rooms , fantastic breakfast from 7 till 12 can't beat it”
Reviews.Author: Redevilgak
Reviews.Content: Very good location , easy to find as it actually joined onto the station , unfortunately was given a room on the train track side which is noisy so ear plugs are recommended if your a light sleeper but better still ask for a room facing the canal , Dam is an expensive place so make use of the all you can eat breakfast which is fantastic :) all in all a good clean and friendly hotel to use as a base to explore the city .

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: mikeh141
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located literally next to the Centraal Station, and is just minutes walk from everything in Amsterdam, including the RLD, countless museums, and the canals. My room was literally right above the train tracks, and I could only hear a little noise as trains passed. Certainly not a bother. The room is small, but comfortable. TV choices were a little lacking, but well, why go to Amsterdam and stay in your hotel room and watch TV, anyway...

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: good location beside a train station. It s good for traveller for a sightseeing around europe and good location for looking around at damtrak and good looking around with city sightseeing bus near at hotel. In front of hotel

Reviews.Title: “Excellent central hotel”
Reviews.Author: markemerson73 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very central and within 5 minutes walk of the main attractions. The rooms very a good size and very clean with an excellent bathroom, however there was no kettle in the room. The room was very quiet despite being almost on the train platform. The staff were helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Birdseye view of Amsterdam and very good value overall”
Reviews.Author: Thilo K
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights (7 & 8 October, booked in advance) at the Ibis Amsterdam Centre prior to our flight back to Australia. The check-in was swift and very efficient. We were given a room at the 9th floor (top) and overlooked part of the Amsterdam Central railway station and adjacent wharf facilities. Our room (964) was very compact and functional, especially the bathroom. The bed was comfortable and we did not hear any outside noises at all (despite being so close to a major railway station and port facility). Food: we opted for the in-house breakfast despite the additional charges. We did not use the hotel restaurant. Service: staff at reception were were helpful in answering our queries and taking care of about 20 post cards (including providing postage stamps). The central location of this hotel makes it an ideal starting point for exploring vibrant Amsterdam. Public transport (only a few meters away) is simple to use. We took advantage of two 24hr tram tickets (7 Euros each) and used it extensively. Based on our previous experience, we have not hesitation to recommend this hotel to others. One word of advice: if using a taxi to Schiphol Airport, make sure the full fare is being established before leaving the hotel. We required payment by credit card and were quoted 40 Euros for the 20 minute journey (traffic dependent) by reception. The taxi contractor (based in the lobby, not the driver) asked for 60 Euros (for using credit card facilities!). We referred back to the hotel advice. He then offered 50 Euros but we insisted on the original quotation. He was not a happy but finally agreed and we arrived at our destination on time and without further problems. However, getting the mobile card swiping machine working took ages. Moreover, according to our bank statement we were charged the correct amount.

Reviews.Title: “Central location and efficient service”
Reviews.Author: Poszewka
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Ibis hotel when attending a conference in Amsterdam. The location of the hotel is really convenient - just in front of the central station. Rooms are very small and simple but clean, which is just enough if youâ€™re busy and only need the hotel to spend the nights there. Service was good in general, however the check in took too long in the late evening. Breakfast was tasty but I never had enough time to properly enjoy it. One morning the hotel staff, seeing me in hurry again, gave me some fruits for the way, which I found a nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel”
Reviews.Author: London09
Reviews.Content: My friends and I were a but hesitant about being this close to the station. We started noticing the trains from about 5.30am onwards, the station annuncements were a little annoying though. But for the price and being so close to the city centre I would say you are getting a great hotel for little price and this is down to the proximity of the station. Very clean, but staff are a little frosty!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient but far too expensive”
Reviews.Author: Hel1982
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very expensive for small rooms which did not have tea making facilities. My room (620), was directly over the train line, and this was very noisy during the night. The hotel was clean and very centrally located.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice price”
Reviews.Author: PuffLitenDrage Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel is quite average. But I would recommend it if you're looking for something with a good location at a nice price. The room was very small, but it was ok as we weren't going to spend alot of awake hours there. Not so good water pressure in the shower, unless you like to shower in cold water. The breakfast buffet was ok. The location was great! Right next to the central station made it very easy to access from the airport. And the hotel was in the downtown area, so we could walk everywhere we wanted to go. The front desk staff was very helpful whenever we needed anything.

Reviews.Title: “Sweet”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Great central location, walking distance to most attractions, transport and the city. Very helpful, friendly staff. Clean modern rooms. Have used this hotel a couple times in the past and will always come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: Heinrich M
Reviews.Content: Central to busses, trains, boats and trams. Good value for your money and friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Good with exeptions”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Everything was good specially the english breakfast, the bar and the restaurant. A few not so good things: 1) Vacuumcleaning of the room, 2) Slaming door in corridor at night and 3) Too low pressure for the heat water in the bathroom on the 7th floor.

Reviews.Title: “Everything nice!!”
Reviews.Author: Gracia D
Reviews.Content: Nice location, I would say it's about walking distance to go everywhere. I mean, the trains are just underneath (yup, our room is exactly above the railway), the boats are across the street, as well as the busses. Moreover, it's only 5 min walk to the shopping alleys; even 15 min walk to the famous red light district. Breakfast quality is good, too. We would definitely go back there 1 day. Somehow, the hotel does not have any parking lot. The parking lot across the street would cost you EUR 55.00/night.

Reviews.Title: “Does what it says on the tin!”
Reviews.Author: Kim79my
Reviews.Content: Hotel was in a great location. So much so that we saw the hotel as the train from the airport pulled into centraal station. The receptionist who checked us in was surly at best. She seemed to have forgotten the customer part of customer service. All receptionist staff we dealt with after that were a lot more friendly and polite. The room was compact but had everything we needed. Our room was in the side that looked out onto the bike park and canal, so although there was noise it was not too bad with the window closed. Bathroom was very small but again had everything you would need. The bar was modern and pleasant and the bar staff prompt and obliging. The hotel was just perfect for or stay, it wasn't fabulous or amzng but it was just what we needed for a short stay in which we spent most of the time outside of the room.

Reviews.Title: “Very good”
Reviews.Author: MarcosGoffredo
Reviews.Content: Really close to Amsterdam Centraal station, and just a few steps from main street, Danrak. Good place to stay if you don't want to waste time. Nice restaurants at the hotel. Would come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Too much for too little”
Reviews.Author: Alan C
Reviews.Content: This is another hotel, like most others in the Ibis chain and many outside that is basically for business people on short stay and expenses. The reception area and the staff were polite and obliging, but did not put themselves out. The room itself and the bathroom on the 3rd floor were small and would not have looked out of place as a small ship's cabin or in a caravan. My usual bugbear is that there are no cupboards to protect clothes from the dust or put private items, just open shelves. Our room overlooked the station and the railway lines. There was not too much noise from that, but it did disturb us on a couple of nights. The choice in the breakfast buffet was not up to the standard of most equivalently priced hotels and the food depended on the time of year. We had fruit, it being Summer, but even then there was not a lot of choice. For the last three months of the year they served a full English breakfast that would have been better from January to March. The drinks machine for tea/coffee that we thought was free was not working for most of our stay and in fact was not free. The other drinks machines on a few floors were so expensive that it was worth a walk in the rain to a supermarket. The hotel is well placed for public transport, but it was easier and more convenient for us to walk everywhere. and we saw more. Being an important, all the family break, all in all it was most disappointing and not at all worth the price. Now we know the city, if we went back we would stay somewhere between the station and the canal area.

Reviews.Title: “Just what you expect from an IBIS”
Reviews.Author: Annaher
Reviews.Content: Good value hotel, easy to find from the train station (2 mins walk). Get what you pay for, basic room, but very clean, secure, helpful staff. Not noisy considering our room was above train tracks! Easy to walk to all sights and easy to find your way back as its right by the station.

Reviews.Title: “Will stay again!”
Reviews.Author: Annahoj1020
Reviews.Content: Firstly... This hotel has the BEST location! We arrived in Amsterdam around 10am and were able to store our luggage in the luggage room until out room was ready. We were even allowed to check into our room an hour early; which was great! I stayed in this hotel for 3 days in a triple room with 2 other friends. It was a good size room, however there was little space to put our belongings etc but it was only a short stay so we keept them in out cases. The shower was amazing very roomy. Down falls for me. No room Service, (understandable as it is a budget hotel) you have to "rent" the kettol and iron. My room was over the train tracts and when the window was open the noise could wake you! finally the bed was comfy but it was almost hand made (not a real bed) I am staying in this hotel again in December and I'm very much looking forward to it. This time I am haveing breakfast so hope the food is good.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, but hot rooms!”
Reviews.Author: Bumblebee2306
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a triple rooms here for a few nights, the location was great! Althought not right in the heart of everything, it was right by the train stattion so it was easy for us all to meet up. It was only a 2 minute walk to get to the laneways and streets of amsterdam. About 5-10 min walk to red light district. We did however have a problem with the AC, it didnt seem to work, we changed rooms, but they seemed to be the same.

Reviews.Title: “Gave this hotel its last chance”
Reviews.Author: lloydim31
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel 3 time in the last 2 months. I must say the location is fantastc its next door to central station which makes the hotel busy, however, the customer service off the staff is terrible. The reception are rude and dont have a clue whos next they answer the phone before they serve waiting customers. check in and check out is so slow. Rooms are very poor for the money even the cleaning staff dont say good morning they just bash around the hall ways from 8am. you can tell the culture of this hotel is get then in get them out. Zero personal attention, unhelpful, rude and not even good value for money. dont have breakfast is just a total unorganised mess and cheep salty products. I have given this hotyel 3 chances and wont stay again. p.s the dont add a-club points they even pretend to swipe your card.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, good location, unfriendly cleaning staff”
Reviews.Author: SputnikOntario
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for several days in September. The hotel overall is a nice average hotel. Our room overlooked the train tracks so there was a bit of noise, although less frequent in the overnight. Breakfast was included in our rate and it was pretty good, but I got sick of it after having it so often. The Breakfast staff are very friendly which is nice. The front desk staff, also very helpful. The cleaning service, however, not so friendly. Never have I been to a hotel where the cleaning lady looked the other way as you passed her in the hallway. And if she did happen to look at you, not a smile, or word spoken. I always smiled at her as I passed, and not even a reciprocated smile back. I started to feel like I had offended her in some way. Maybe my room was overly messy. I don't know. All I know is that I've never experienced that in all my hotel stays (which are plentiful). Anyway aside from that the hotel is decent, but rooms are super tiny and the bathroom even smaller. I had to sit angled on the toilet because my knees kept hitting the wall. I'm not even that tall. We ate in the restaurant there once and the food was average. Its nice they have a bar and restaurant. Internet is 3.95 euro/day for wireless in the room. I thought this wasn't a bad price considering how expensive internet usually is. You could also use it for free in the lobby for an hour. I'd say this hotel is good value for the location and services available.

Reviews.Title: “Room for improvement”
Reviews.Author: slsl_22
Reviews.Content: We stayed @ the above hotel for 3 nights. Location was good as it is just beside the train station. But some of the let-downs are as follows: -the air-conditioner in our room was so noisy that it kept my partner away the whole of the 1st night that we finally cannot tolerate anymore that we requested for a change of room in the middle of the night at 3am. - our room was not being cleaned and tidied up on the 2nd day, despite us putting the "Pls make the room" sign outside our door, when we left around 1030am in the morning. We returned to an uncleaned room around 4pm, and thus called the reception to inform them that our room was not been cleaned and tidied. They informed us that their housekeeping could only come @5pm, which means we need to wait 1 hour or so. In the end, as we were to leave for another sightseeing location as well as dinner, we decided not to wait for the housekeeping and merely request for a clean change of towels. So much for their 15 mins gurantee policy to solve all problems, else the stay would to be free which was widely advertised everywhere in the hotel. I doubt the staff dared to mention about this policy since the housekeeping didnt come within 15 mins.

Reviews.Title: “suitable for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: Venus V
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just perfect for a short stay. Don't expect super fancy facilities. I haven't tried the food there though so I can't judge. It's clean, quite and organized. Has an excellent location. However, we still found it too expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Very handy for train station, short walk to city centre”
Reviews.Author: Lawsie26
Reviews.Content: Basic room, fairly tidy, bit of a muddle of a hotel, needed 2 different lifts and bit of a walk along a very hot corridor to get to room

Reviews.Title: “Minimalist Hotel - Good location, bad hotel choice”
Reviews.Author: Richard Y
Reviews.Content: The hotel has no toiletries, beds are VERY small. Two beds next to one another on a wooden floor. Beds keep sliding apart. Asked for a wake up call two days in a row. Both days the wake up call was not correct. VERY hot. No air conditioning, windows slightly open. No "all news" cable channel in the room. Location is good. Quiet. Clean

Reviews.Title: “Will stay in this hotel again.”
Reviews.Author: swea_p
Reviews.Content: Good value and convenient to station and tourist spots.

Reviews.Title: “Its good for Amsterdam standards.”
Reviews.Author: elliotsm
Reviews.Content: Location wise this is a fantastic hotel, right next to central station and a 2 minute (watch out for bikes!) walk into town. Staff are friendly and check in was quick and easy plus we were able to leave our bags in a secure room before checking in and after we left which was great. We paid 365 euros for a 2 night stay which we thought was a little pricey, if you can get a cheaper deal you would feel better about what you were getting. The room was HOT even with he air con full and temperature outside was only around 17oc, wouldn't like to be present on a sunny day. The smell of weed constantly in the corridor for a no smoking hotel was also not something we were expecting and something which nobody really cared about. Food / vending was very overpriced, 6.00 euro for a bottle of water which was sold in a shop down the street for 95 cent! Overall its a good clean hotel and worth it if you can get a good deal, if not you may come away feeling slighty confused with what you actually just paid for.

Reviews.Title: “we loved and well be back”
Reviews.Author: daliasiani
Reviews.Content: Your hotel Ibis Amsterdam Centre is situated by the main train station. Trains, metros, buses, trams and taxis . Schiphol airport is just 15 minutes away by train, the RAI center just 20 mins by tram and the ARENA 15 mins by metro. Other destinations such as the PTA cruise terminal, Beurs van Berlage, the Dam Square and the shops. good breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: londonmagpie
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a three night break, location is great. Two minutes from the central station. Rooms are basic, but clean and comfortable. Staff very pleasant. Breakfast is good, 7am to noon, so no rush to get there early. Ideal place to say as you can walk everywhere in this delightful city.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: basakiper
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a great location! I would definitely stay here again if I ever have a chance to visit Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Would recommend”
Reviews.Author: barba m
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at the costly Crowne Plaza previously, I was a little sceptic about staying at a cheaper hotel. There were five of us staying at the hotel, I was sharing a twin room and whilst the room was very small and basic, it was clean. We were simply using the room for sleeping purposes only as we were out all day. On one of the mornings we went down for breakfast, it was a little expensive as there really was not much on offer. I would not recommend paying for breakfast when there are lots of places nearby. Room small, breakfast not worth the money, however if you are looking for a cheap, clean place in an ideal location, this hotel is for you. I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Location is great!!”
Reviews.Author: goldenmouse
Reviews.Content: Stay in this hotel for 2 days, is next to the central station so it is very convenient. The receptionist is a bit rude and not helpful

Reviews.Title: “Not a Bad Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BlazingHoliday
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel which is situated next to the train station, it is very clean and we had not issues with 3 to a room either. The buffet breakfast was ok, though a little more variety wouldn't go a miss. No real issues to comment on. Though probably would not come back here.

Reviews.Title: “very conveniently located”
Reviews.Author: ASHMombasa
Reviews.Content: We were a group of three sharing one room, we stayed for only one night, the location of this hotel is perfect, literally 2 minutes from the railway platforms, 5 minutes from the nearest coffeshop, very ideal for people going to enjoy amsterdam 'coffee'. The accomodation and rooms are average but we only used the rooms for the beds and the bathroom, and it served our purpose very well.

Reviews.Title: “We loved It”
Reviews.Author: Dennis S
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, very clean, Great location for transportation - trains - trams - canals and taxis. The rooms are a little small, but great for a visit, sleeping and shower. Some complain about train noise but I found the room quiet. The electric trains make little noise and the rooms are much quieter than those with street noise. The check in and out was fast and friendly. Our room was not quite ready when we arrived, they provide a locked storage area for luggage and had the room ready when we returned from lunch.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Service”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: My stay was marred by a horrible receptionist called Juira who was astonishingly rude when all I was doing was checking in. Apart from that the rest of the staff were nice, the rooms were very clean and the location very good.

Reviews.Title: “Any”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel was really good. Really well located. Staff was very friendly. The only complain I have is due to the noise of trains but, of course, I know that little (if nothing) can be done to solve such problem. I noticed that the windows are duplicated, probably as an attempt to cancel the noise coming from the station under the hotel. However, something more should be considered, 'cause even in the 6th floor, during the night, the noise was kind of disturbing. Thank you for listening.

Reviews.Title: “Well located, functional hotel”
Reviews.Author: MXLondon
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night as there was a problem with my booking at a different hotel. As I walked up to get the room, the rate was higher than I would expect (over â‚¬150). The hotel is very big and located immediately adjacent to the railway station. There was some train noise in my room (which was over the train tracks) which I didn't mind, but it may disturb some people. If you stay in a higher floor you have to go up one lift, then walk along and take another lift. This means that it can take several minutes to get to and from the room. The room was a standard Ibis room: clean, basic and comfortable. I would stay here again but would hope to pay less by booking further in advance.

Reviews.Title: “Restayed at this centrally located hotel”
Reviews.Author: LeithW
Reviews.Content: 2nd stays in 9 months. Still like the excellent location to everywhere in Amsterdam. Right next to Main central station in Amsterdam, ( walking distance of less than 100m ) infront its main tram stations to most places in city centre. Hotel facilities perhaps 3 stars, its basic, but clean. and with FREE WIFI at hotel lobby. Ask front desk for passwords and username.

Reviews.Title: “Would certainly stay there again.”
Reviews.Author: RhondaL
Reviews.Content: Arrived around 9 a.m. and they had a room for me within the hour. I had no complaints about the hotel. I thought that the breakfast was excellent - good variety of foods. The only reason I did not give it a "5" was that it was near the train station and you could hear the trains. This didn't bother me but it might bother some. The room was clean and comfortable and the hotel was well located. The people at the front desk were very helpful. The price was great too. Would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: aussieworldtraveller
Reviews.Content: Great location bus, trai and trams almost at the door. Rooms clean and comfortable, food great.

Reviews.Title: “good value and in the city central”
Reviews.Author: trcfill
Reviews.Content: The best part of this hotel is that it is convenient. If you know your way around Amsterdam, as we do, then you can jump on a tram and get around. But the rooms are small, but clean, and it comfortably slept (in 2 twin beds), and a tiny shower. No amenities, like coffee, food, and no frills. Staff was nice, but all business. We have since found the Hotel Schipol A4 and found a better value for the Euro. The only draw back of NOT staying in town, is that you have to get back to the airport to catch the hotel shuttle, otherwise, for the value, as Ibis JUST went way up on their price, I will probably stay at Hotel Schipol

Reviews.Title: “Hotel with a great location”
Reviews.Author: UtQ
Reviews.Content: I usually stay in this hotel when I'm in Amsterdam as it is right next to the Central Train Station and walking distance to almost all attraction points. I can not say that it is the cheapest one considering what u get against, but on an avarage, this hotel passes from my quality standarts. I shall suggest the guests to stay (if possible) in the rennovated floors.

Reviews.Title: “Good location in central Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Sue331966
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ibis Amsterdam Centre for 7 nights in July. We couldn't fault the location. Next door to Centraal Station and a 5 minute walk to Dam Square. The Red Light district was about a 10 minute walk from the hotel. There were 3 of us in a triple room and this was very tight. It was very hard to move and with our suitcases, it gave us even less space. Bathroom was tiny and no minibar/fridge in the room. Breakfast was not included, and very expensive at 15 Euro per person. There are many fast food and cafes close by where you can get cheaper food.

Reviews.Title: “OK, but pricey for an Ibis”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Staff were excellent, loctation is very good, but was pricey for an Ibis. Having to pay to use an iron is unreasonable and the (paid) internet connection does not allow more than one device to connect to the network.

Reviews.Title: “Mostly good”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: First the good stuff: The hotel is superbly located right next to the railway station for when you arrive/leave Amsterdam and very close to the Tram terminus for getting around the City. We stayed in the block that actually straddles 2 of the railway platforms and it was always very interesting just to look out of the window and see what was going on in the station as well as all the shipping in the waterway behind. The sound insulation was excellent and noise was never a problem. The staff too were another good point - friendly and helpful when arranging to leave our luggage and when providing the voucher to use free Wifi in the lobby. On the down side, though the room was superficially clean I noticed that the side of the bed was covered in a range of different stains and the sealant in the shower had the usual black marks. The other big problem was the cost of everything - 15 euros for a breakfast and 2.5 euros for a self service coffee or a canned drink from the vending machine.

Reviews.Title: “Cramped Rooms at Exorbitant Tariff”
Reviews.Author: abhi_jsr
Reviews.Content: Location of hotel is quite good . But the tariff is very high. The rooms are cramped with no place to move around. You donot get anything complimentary in the room. Not even a bottle of water. You have to wait a long to Check-In or Check-Out. Air conditioning also did not function well in the room. Free Internet is also not Available in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Its great for short stays!”
Reviews.Author: artifactory
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Amsterdam just a few days, but we enjoyed the city as much as we could. The hotel is located right by the train station and it has access to the biggest bicycle parking garage I've ever seen. To get to the hotel is kind of tricky but easy once you do it one time... parking is bad. You either have to park in the city parking garage which is 50 EUROS a night or have to drive to a distante parking where you leave your car and take the train back. It was annoying that the guy at the front desk was very specific when he gavel directions or did not mention the fact that we need it a special ticket in order to get the special deal per night.... we end up paying some 80 EUROS for two nights.... which it would had been half of that if we had known of the special ticket to be claim at the front desk or window in the parking lot. The hotel rooms are really small, clean but small. All the essentials are in place and the hotel is always busy. I like it, is not the type of hotel I'd love to come and stay but is good for one or two nights.

Reviews.Title: “Clean hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: 786ZHR
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent a night here during our European holiday and don't regret chosing the hotel mainly for the location and well known brand. Rooms are small although neat and modern. Perfect position if you arrive/depart by train and from which to explore the city either by tram, ubiquitous bicycles or canal cruise, all located literally in front of the hotel. Breakfast was very good regarding variety and taste. Internet access in lobby was relatively cheap and fast, coin operated. Luggage storage allowed extra time for sight seeing after check in and seemed secure. On the expensive side, but worth it considering all.

Reviews.Title: “Does what it says. Good.”
Reviews.Author: Rhooseboy
Reviews.Content: We could not fault with the hotel. After early morning flight we were pleasently surprised informed we could check in at 9am. The rooms are small but this is Amsterdam, they were clean and functional. Shower always produced hot water and pressure not bad. No tea / coffee machine in the room. There is a 24hr self service but the coffee was 2.5 Euros. As mentioned in majority of reports, location was great. We did have breakfast included in the rate and it was a good standard and available from 6am - 12pm it also allows people to lie in. I would stay again and recommend others to do so.

Reviews.Title: “Central location. Good continental breakfast. Bit costly”
Reviews.Author: ntn_chndrn
Reviews.Content: I visited Amsterdam in May 2010. I stayed there for 1 night and 2 days at the Ibis Amsterdam Center. It costed me around 140 Euros - did not find a better place at a good price. The best part of this place is the connectivity and proximity to all the happening places in Amsterdam. Best things: The breakfast was real good. Hotel staff were courteous. Real nice and cozy room for a solo traveller (costly though) Not so good: Expensive - due to central location (and season might be - Keukenhof Tulip show) Hot water tap was not working You just need to take a 1 day tram pass and roam around full day (and night). Unfortunately there was some kind of a strike and the garbage was not cleaned and so Amsterdam was looking not so clean. But it is a must visit place.

Reviews.Title: “Don't expect any service or cleanliness”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Funny description on the site of IBIS Amsterdam Centre: they would exceed my expectations of the room etc? This looked like a youth hostel, black hairs in towel and bed. Can it get dirtyer? WIFI only via reception, very easy uhuh. The staff in bar talking about you, only a bit to loud so you hear it. I would compare it with an overpriced youth hostel My next time? Will pay 75 euro more and go to a decent hotel, less close to the Central Station.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: AfshinM Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The rooms and bathrooms are too small. For the price one pays in Europe, you would get a 4 star hotel in USA. But I guess Europe is too expensive. The hotel is in a good locaton, next to the train station and restaurant areas. The staff are friendly and the breakfast is decent. Have stayed many times at this Ibis hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the money”
Reviews.Author: DavidTOttawa Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This is a fine Ibis Hotel and after we changed our room from one overlooking the train tracks (literally, the train carriage was 20 feet from our window) to one on the other side, we were satisfied. For those who are used to the Ibis chain, they will find the rooms, including the bathroom to be smaller than the average. But the staff were quite helpful although overworked at times.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, but long wait at check in.”
Reviews.Author: lloydim31
Reviews.Content: This hotel is next to central station so has a great location to have a look at Amsterdam. My room on the 7th floor was just as expected for an IBIS hotel, good shower and clean. The were a few negative points, long wait at check in the last thing you want when you have been flying all day. the aircon in the room did not cool so the room was to hot and the windows dont open. Breakfast was in a mess at 10am(they must have had there morning rush) no welcome infact anyone could just walk in had eat some food. very poor selection for the cost that was in addition to the night rate.(this is not a breakfast lovers hotel) Had a A club card and the points were not added even though it looked like they took the details.

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms, great for child who like trains and ferry.”
Reviews.Author: Jsgc
Reviews.Content: Great location, I was at tower B, great view of the tran station. My son totally love it. The shower was spacious but room a bit small. I am a party of 3. 1 thing, cannot find any fridge in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Cape8101
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ibis for several nights. This hotel was selected for it's location and the Ibis reputation for being very clean. Being next to the train station was very nice. The rooms are small, but we didn't spend much time there.

Reviews.Title: “VERY convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a short walk from Centraal Station and is very easy to go around town from there once you've checked. The place is priced for the location, the hotel itself is just okay and average. No complaints here.

Reviews.Title: “A great location!”
Reviews.Author: LJC309
Reviews.Content: This hotel, located next to the train station and the canal boats station, was the perfect hotel for us. The rooms were very small, but that was okay because we were in Amsterdam to see the city sights. The bathroom was REALLY small! The hotel had a locked room to store our luggage.

Reviews.Title: “Not value for money.”
Reviews.Author: linorg
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here several times during the passed years. This time I was not pleased with service and how they handled things.

Reviews.Title: “loved hotel”
Reviews.Author: jen007Newcastle
Reviews.Content: very clean central hotel with pleasant receptionists.nothing too much trouble. good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Be Put Off By Proximity to Railway Station - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: HoneyAndPaul
Reviews.Content: Upgraded because of A-Club Frequent Guest to corner room with double glazing as hotel right over the tracks at the main railway station. Comfortable bed and pillows, two great views, handy to city, breakfast was good but ordinary, free internet, staff incredibly good and helpful, bathroom fine and handy to absolutely everythingâ€¦.walk from station to hotel. Great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Hockey Base”
Reviews.Author: numptycoach
Reviews.Content: Stayed here at Easter as our base for the EuroHockey League KO16. Excellent location, short walk to restaurants, Dam Square in the evenings. Next to Central Station which we needed to get out to Bloemendaal very early 2 mornings. Room was good size, very clean. Excellent shower. No noise problem being next to Central Station.

Reviews.Title: “Above the train station, literally!”
Reviews.Author: andreplastic
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Hotel for one night with some friend in may 2011. The Ibis Centre is close to the amsterdam centraal train station, just 3 minutes walking from when you get of the train. lobby personel speaks fluent english and they are quite helpful when asked for direction in the city. Rooms are quite little, mine was a double room with one bed plus, as we where in 3. Bath have a quite big an comfortable shower, with bath and shampoo gel. I din't had any breakfast so I can't tell nothing about it. Non smoking policy is respected in every place inside the hotel. Wifi connection is for payment only.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location but you pay for it”
Reviews.Author: rubbertgator
Reviews.Content: This Ibis is near the train station and the center of Amsterdam. The location couldn't be better, but please note that the rooms are unusually tiny, even for an Ibis. Given that things are expensive in Amsterdam, you probably get what you pay for, but bring a small suitcase. Otherwise you won't be able to get into your room!

Reviews.Title: “this hotel is certainly as close as you can get to the station...”
Reviews.Author: SarieM
Reviews.Content: We travelled in winter, and did not want to rent a car, so wanted to stay in hotels as close to the railway station as we could manage... and we did. The room was perfectly adequate and comfortable, the view over the railway tracks stunning, and on the day we arrived there was a lot of snow so it was as easy getting to the hotel with our luggage as it was getting to the taxi queue. We ate in the hotel some nights, as we couldn't face walking far enough in the snow and ice to get to a lesser tourist trap. Unexciting food but okay international bland fare. Most of the staff were really impressive and gave excellent service. When I needed a doctor, the hotel was really helpful and prompt about organising one. As non-smokers, we loved the non-smoking policy of this hotel and the firmness with which management sent smokers outside the front door...
