The rooms also had windows that could be opened ... in summer this hotel might be very noisy.

Reviews.Title: “Good But Too Expensive”
Reviews.Author: TOTHEALEX
Reviews.Content: The hotel is good, but no real view and way too expensive. (hey, but maybe all things in Amsterdam are). Rooms are very, very tiny, but clean and livable. My only grudges are - breakfasts are too expensive (15 euros per person) - we had breakfasts at better prices at local cafes and they charge you for Internet - to me it is like charging for TV in the room (however, there's a way out - you ask for an hour of free Internet) at the reception. The hotel is located right next to the train station. It is close to all places - Red Light District and Main Square. Convenient if you are traveling from Amsterdam anywhere else by train. The bottomline - it is only good for crashing at night, but at the price of 160 euros (or so) way too much for what it has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and a lovely clean room”
Reviews.Author: wheronui
Reviews.Content: We has a great 3 night stay here. The staff were friendly and helpful whenever we needed them. The room was not massive but very clean and had everything we needed and a good bed. The best thing is the location. Right next to the central station so very easy to find your way anywhere else, and find your way back. All trams, buses and canal boats are really close as well. Fantastic overall experience.

Reviews.Title: “Good position was only saving grace for this one...”
Reviews.Author: Beachworth
Reviews.Content: Couple plus adult son stayed in 2 rooms for 3 days. Had to change rooms as no aircon working and locked into heat position, making room unbearable to be in. As this hotel is right next door to the main railway station, the constant train movement can be felt often. T he rooms are very small and basic with no fridge. As this was one of the most expensive on this ttrip, I was surprised by the lack of good facilities. The bed was impossibly hard and together with the vibrations of the trains, made for lack of good sleep. Outside was dirty and clogged with 100's of bicycles at the front door and several homeless people were in close vicinity. Could not recommend. No problem with the staff. They helped where they could.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Small Room”
Reviews.Author: ChefDemonios Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location and the staff is very resourceful and helpful; however, the rooms are very small, especially the bathroom. It was so small that one had to sit on the toilet sideways, in fact.

Reviews.Title: “Amsterdam Ibis Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Great hotel for access to rail transportation to airport. Price is right. We stayed here at the tail end of a trip to other parts of Holland after having stayed at a more centrally located, more expensive Amsterdam hotel at the beginning of the trip. However, since Amsterdam is compact and such a great walking city, it was not difficult to cover all of the Amsterdam loop from this hotel's location.

Reviews.Title: “Good , but way to expensive”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Amsterdam is absolutely overpriced .. There is absolutely no reason why a hotel of Ibis quality should be priced over 100 Euro per night. (Or why a parking should be priced 55 Euro daily) Lets face it Amsterdam is an American Tourist trap and sadly it shows in prices .. The hotel claims free Wifi in the Lobby , however that doesn't come with a dhcp lease so you don't get any connectivity (we tried with multiple devices ) Sadly there aren't much alternatives around ... Apart from the Prices this is a good standard Ibis hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Iffy service, quiet rest”
Reviews.Author: Ottawa00
Reviews.Content: Ibis Amsterdam Centre is steps from the Central Station, making this an extremely convenient location. The downside: checking in, out or otherwise dealing with anything that relies on the front desk is a bit of a nightmare. The front desk and lobby area are not nearly big enough to accomodate the volume of visitors coming in to this hotel. Service moves slowly. Ibis has decided not to staff positions to help store baggage, so while you wait to check in you must also rely on the busy front desk to buzz you into either the washrooms or the luggage check! I was a bit put off but all the "cost cutting" - they also charge you four euros just to get wifi... However, on the plus side, our rooms (while compact, and dorm-like) were very clean, and well insulated against sound - doors close silently and we heard not a peep which was miraculous considering the kinds of crazy partying that goes on in this town.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Staff and outstanding location make this the best hotel in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: achrisNewJersey
Reviews.Content: In Amsterdam, the tram is the fastest and cheapest way to connect major sights, which are very spread out across the city. Having access to a larger tram station is very important when looking for a hotel. All trams begin or end at Centraal Station, which the Hotel Ibis is just steps away from. Walk just 50 feet and you are able to board a tram taking you to any sight in Amsterdam. As for the hotel, the staff is the friendliest I have ever seen. If you are a light sleeper you may want to look elsewhere because the trains going past in Centraal Station can be somewhat bothersome, but they usually stop be around 10 pm. Overall this is one of the finest hotels I have ever stayed at.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: KAZHOWARD Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: the hotel is great very clean very secure, the rooms were a little on the small side but we were only in them to sleep which was fine. location was great right next door to the main train station which goes straight too and from the airport, easy enough for anyone. the hotels modern its not at all shabby or old. i think the only bad point is there is no drinking facilities in the room like a cup of tea or coffee which would have been most appreciated after a heavy night in town. Quite expensive for what you get and would be a little less harsh on the pocket if there was more room facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Probably the best budget hotel in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: CornelOprea
Reviews.Content: Great price for a clean hotel,nice and helpful staff and a fabulous location in central Amsterdam .

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, reasonable hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Hotel is just next to Amsterdam Central Station so very convenient. Good and friendly service at the reception and there are always enough people to handle lots of guests who check in/out. The rooms are very clean and new. Beds are bit small, but acceptable.

Reviews.Title: “Small room, no double bed - but a restful sleep!”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I was allocated a room on the 7th floor. My room was very small, and I was given two single beds, arranged in an 'L' formation (one bed against each wall) as there was not space to push the beds side by side. A minor quibble, as I was only staying for one night. And so this arrangement was bearable. But I think, had my stay been longer than a couple of nights, the room would have become a little claustrophobic! The bathroom was also extremely tight on space - fortunately, I am of slight frame/build, and so again, this was bearable & functional for my short stay. But I do not feel this would be adequate space for someone of a larger frame, nor someone who was staying for a longer duration. That said, my bed was comfy, and the hotel was perfectly located for the city, train station, and the conference I was attending with work) AND the staff were extremely helpful, and even refunded the 2 euros difference when it was apparent we'd been marginally overcharged for our room! So all round, a good experience at this hotel. And I would recommend for anyone planning a short business trip to the city. Helen - Canterbury, Kent

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gordon10
Reviews.Content: Good hotel Ibis it does what it says on the tin. Good breakfast ,clean rooms albiet slightly on the small side [but you are only sleeping in it].Staff friendly and efficent.

Reviews.Title: “basic, clean and excellent breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: Niseach16
Reviews.Content: Had some difficulties checking in as they would not accept corporate booking from our travel agent without completing more forms however once that was sorted we were given our rooms. Two out of our three rooms were fine but my (non smoking) room had obviously been used by a smoker and the smell in the toilet was foul! A new room was allocated and it was fine was clean and fresh! Breakfast was excellent with a huge selection of cereals and hot and cold items. Excellent city centre location location.

Reviews.Title: “Bedbugs - beware”
Reviews.Author: Bitten96
Reviews.Content: Just checked out of this hotel. A terrible night's sleep. Found live bed bugs crawling over the bed in the middle of the night. When I got up to inspect the mattress it was absolutely seething. I relocated to another room, which did not seem to be infested. They dealt with the problem well, and gave me a voucher for dry cleaning, but still, I would watch out.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice!”
Reviews.Author: Antonia-Constantinos
Reviews.Content: Nice and small. Nothing impressive but value for money, given the high prices of accommodation in Amsterdam. Most important: CLEAN!!! Recommended for people who would like a simple clean room.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, perfect hotel, all was perfect...!”
Reviews.Author: PavkaR
Reviews.Content: We were stay in this hotel with my coleague two nights. It was perfect. Only a few steps from Amsterdam Central Station. Absolutly at city centre. All interesting points at Amsterdam are only a few minutes by walk from hotel. Nex to hotel are subway station and tram station with connection to the all Amsterdam city area. Rooms are very clean, bed was very comfortable, nice view to the Amsterdam harbour. Sometime was little bit noisy from Central station and trams, but it wasÂ´nt horrible. Breakfast was absolutly fantastic, personal is very friendly and helpful. My next stay at Amsterdam will be at this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel , room was very confortable, good service and great location!

Reviews.Title: “Breakfast not international”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The Breakfast are prepered only for local guests, if you are from a another country, you will be unsatisfied about obtions available in the hotel, and the price are very expansive if you compare to another options in the neiberhood.

Reviews.Title: “Decent location, good brekkie, averagely priced for amdam”
Reviews.Author: Bento20
Reviews.Content: Good location right next to the station, with superb tram links nearby and a walkable distance to central square. Brekkie is between 6-12 which is brilliant with a good selection of breads, cereals, fruits etc. Its not a budget hotel but you get what you pay for. Overall I would defo recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Spartan Hotel”
Reviews.Author: maxleo72
Reviews.Content: If you are into spartan hotels, then perhaps this would be a good bet for you. The room was small, and VERY no-frills. Boring, I would say.

Reviews.Title: “Easy access to city centre and transport to airport”
Reviews.Author: brodebec
Reviews.Content: A very basic hotel in a very convenient location. Easy walking distance to Amsterdam central station and to town/red light district. Feels a little like a 1960s hospital though, hasn't had an upgrade for some time which shows in bathrooms and with the carpet. A good choice if you want a well placed bed as opposed to a room for relaxation.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location”
Reviews.Author: LeithW
Reviews.Content: We tend to to stay in hotel with good transport eg train, underground, tram, bus etc.. and this one have it all. Situated right next to Central Station. You may take a train from Schipol Airport and reach here. Less than 2, 3 mins walk from station to this hotel, passing through a "seas" of bicycles. Look out for where the 3,000 bicycles park!! this hotel is right opp. You would expect Ibis standards, room very small but the location is so so good. You can take plenty trams ( it's a central tram sations right outside) if explore around central Amsterdam. Or else trains take you all over Holland and across europe. Not to mss out bus service is pretty good too.

Reviews.Title: “A very freindly city, worth a visit. Walk everywhere and avoid taxi's”
Reviews.Author: pusser_10
Reviews.Content: We arrived late in Amsterdam because of Easyjet and their usual poor punctuality. As we walked from the railway station - thanks to trip advisor, saving a lot of Euro in a taxi - we noticed that we felt very safe even at midnight carrying a suitcase. The hotel was ok. Very basic and not exactly the highlight of the weekend. But it was only a place to sleep. We had a very enjoyable weekend touring around a very friendly and easy to navigate. Visiting the sights and even visiting the red light district. Which is well worth a wonder round. We had a good time in a very friendly city where the cyclist is King

Reviews.Title: “Terrible staff attitudes”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel location is perfect next to amsterdam central station makes it easy to get to from the airport and back ,but the price is high compared to the hotel service (overvalued).what makde me disapointed is the staff atitudes which are not friendly at all and they treat guest with suspesion like they take long to check guests in and i asked for an iron they asked me for credit card to garantees i bring back the iron.

Reviews.Title: “Fraudulent management and thieves”
Reviews.Author: armenicum
Reviews.Content: I booked a room in this hotel for 10 days and then wanted to cancell teh booking since I found a better place. Guess what, they charged the full amoutn of 10 day stay and refused to reimburse me. Even thought booking and cancellation took place 4 weeks before the booked date!!! When I called them, they said, yes that is true, that is their police - you can cancel but you are not getting your moneys back!

Reviews.Title: “Central location, ideal for touristic adventure”
Reviews.Author: mla07
Reviews.Content: Just back from a 2 night stay at the Ibis. We arrived from Amsterdam airport, directly to Central Station (15 mins journey - rtn price for 2 pax is 13.50 euros). Central station is 2 mins away from the hotel on your right hand side. We checked in at 1200 without any problem. Our room was on the 8th floor in tower B. we could hear the trains but to be honest it wasnt a problem: we still had a good night sleep. Breakfast was plenty: self service so you can go for more. Choice of croissants, breads, yogurt, cereals, eggs, mini sausages and scrambled or boiled eggs, bananas and apples. The only negative point was that there is no coffee making facilities in the room. The staff were very friendly and always helpful! We checked out at 1200 and left our suitcases at the hotel "luggage store" which was ideal. The hotel is on a great location: next to the main rail station, near the canal cruises, and next to the main tourist monuments.. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A bit space limited.”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We had a triple room. The space was very limited with 3 people and 3 suit cases. Sine it was a 1 night stopover to Schiphol it was ok. It was right next door to the Amsterdam railway station where we arrived from Limburg. The online booking worked well as we booked through Accorhotels.

Reviews.Title: “Amsterdam 2 day leisure trip”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Very convenient location, walking distance to major attractions. Clean rooms and very good service.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff, awful coffee.”
Reviews.Author: frinls
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night here in the summer and loved the central location - perfect for a stopover on a long railway journey, and only minutes from the station. The receptionist was very welcoming, our room quite pleasant. I had wondered if we would hear much from the station, but it was in fact very quiet. The layout of the hotel is unusual, requiring guests to change from one building to another on a floor well above the ground floor. The only disappointment was at breakfast. My partially-sighted husband found the layout of the breakfast buffet confusing, and it was very difficult to find a table when we arrived. However, the disappointment was the vending machine coffee in the breakfast room. It was so bad, the first thing we did that day was walk to the station to find a better cuppa.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location.”
Reviews.Author: lesley999Walsall
Reviews.Content: Just got back from 3 nights at the Ibis Central. As many others have said this hotel is great for its location right next to the train station and within very easy walking distance of much of Amsterdam. The trams and buses also leave from outside the railway station one minutes walk away from the hotel's front door. I had read the many reviews on here and so requested a room which had been renovated (Tower B) and one with a harbour view, which we got. We arrived at around 10.30/11.00am and were pleasantly surprised to be given our room keys straight away. We were on the 8th floor and although we could hear faint train noise at odd times it certainly didn't keep us awake at night. Our room was fine. We had a big sized double bed and a small, but perfectly fine bathroom with a very big shower and hairdryer. Everywhere was clean. The only thing lacking was tea/coffee making facilities in the room. Our breakfasts were included in the room rate and were good- so good that we didn't need to eat at lunch times! All of the staff in the hotel were friendly and very helpful. At breakfast time if you sat on one side of the dining room you could see the trains pulling in and out of the station. If you are a train spotter I would imagine you would be in seventh heaven here! The lifts were large and quick and you needed your room key/card to access them so you felt safe. All in all we found the Ibis to be a perfectly acceptable hotel in a very good location and yes I certainly wouldn't hesitate in staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, but lacking in some of the basics”
Reviews.Author: ChrisCoupland
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located literally seconds away from the central station, and it takes just minutes to walk to the very heart of Amsterdam. Right outside the door is the bike rental place, and the tram, but and river taxi termini, so if you want to go further than walking distance, you can do so easily. The staff on the fro desk are very helpful, and always treated me and my travelling buddy with respect and courtesy, letting us keep our baggage in in the hotel for several hours both before and after check in/out. The rooms were clean, but not spotless, and the bathrooms leave a fair bit to be desired. The heater i the bathroom, and the extractor fan were both filled with dust and fluff, and looked as if they hadn't been given more than a cursory once-over in a long time. The bathroom is small to the extent that i at 6'1" found it difficult to sit on the facilities. The shower was spacious though, and the water was a good pressure and not too hot or changeable. The bedroom itself was a bit small, and not a double as booked, but twins pushed together, so i could not sprawl as i am wont to do. However, the bed was comfy and clean, with a good wakeup call service in the morning. Once woken up , the breakfast is excellent, if a little pricey at 15 Euros per head. For hat, though, you can take as much as you like, and the food is of a very high quality. The bar food, too, is good quality, although Ibis do seem to charge exorbitant amounts, even by hotel standards. There is free WiFi to the extent that you can ask for an hour in the bar, but if you want to take it to your room, you will have to pay 4 Euros for the privilege. It is not particularly high speed, other, but gift horses' mouths oughtn't be looked in. There are also 2 PCs in the lobby for Internet access, although. This costs about 1 Euro for just 10 minutes on the web... Expensive by any standards. Overall, a not unpleasant experience, but I would probably not stay here again, and I'd recommend that a friend look at alternatives a bit more before deciding to go for convenient location over VfM.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible "hotel"”
Reviews.Author: savdjsav
Reviews.Content: I have travelled to Amsterdam many times fro business and have stayed in a few hotels but on this occassion decided to try a different hotel. I had booked 3 nights but only stayed the 1 as I had a restless night from the hard bed, noise of the trains that run parallel to the hotel and the noise from the rooms around me - toilets fluching loudly etc. The room looked and felt 20 years old and for 120 euros a night you'd expect much, much more. In fact I moved to a 'superior' room in another hotel for 130 euros a night! I say "hotel" because the room felt more like a hostel and included a brown substance on the the toilet paper I dared to investigate. To add insult to injury the reception supervisor started arguing with me asking "why didn't you give us a chance, we could have moved you?". How about apologising to me for placing me in a room that's noisy, old and creates the type of mood you do not want at the end of the day. Now, mostly down to the attitude of the reception supervisor, I will definately not be staying in any Ibis hotels, anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Compact, cleanish, comfortable enough, great location and helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: AussieBurnie Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Located on top of the central railway station it is well situated for both city walk in access and country side or intercity rail access. Plenty of restaurants within walking distance. The main shopping basically starts opposite and heads away for a long way. On arrival we were given two rooms in a tower with failed air-conditioning. On complaining, we were moved to the second tower without any hassles - thank you. The staff were all helpful with our requests. Rooms are smallish, but adequate with relatively modern furnishings and a good mattress - very important. Servicing was daily, but the floor cleaning was noticeably cursory. Interestingly, some 10,000 bicycles are parked outside the hotels doors.

Reviews.Title: “Good Times!!!”
Reviews.Author: the_black_prodigy
Reviews.Content: I have never written a review on a hotel before, but after my trip to Amsterdam I thought that it was only fair that I shared my experience with everyone as I know how daunting it can be to get the right hotel. After reading the other reviews on Trip Adviser, me and my partner decided to choose this hotel, if I am honest I wasnâ€™t too impressed by the reviews and wanted to go somewhere else, but my partner really wanted to go to this hotel as it had a free breakfast with our deal. I am glad we did choose this hotel as it was ideal!!! The hotel room was exactly how it was in the pictures, it was clean, not that small and had a modern feel to it. I have a feeling thou that is does depend in which block you stay in as we stayed in block B (on the 6th floor). One of the views from the room wasnâ€™t the greatest but the other window was a view of the harbour which was nice enough. Like most people have previously said, the hotel is ideally located by the station and 5 minutes walk from all the action! Breakfast was nice enough and the staff were very pleasant! We arrived at around 10am and we were able to leave our luggage at the hotel whilst we went for a walk about. Overall I had a good time in this hotel and would definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Janine11982
Reviews.Content: A clean and simple hotel in a great location. Easy check in and out, breakfast served until midday and staff pleasant at most times. The bed was on wheels, which was a little strange and it was a little noisy due to being located over the train station. We did have the windows open all of the time due to it being so warm which will have contributed to the noise. Overall, better than I expected.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: ABoshrouye
Reviews.Content: main advantage of the hotel is its location. it is located on Amsterdam center; right close to Amsterdam train centraal station, tram (GVB) and canal bus and bus station which give you easy accessibility to most of the Amsterdam attractions including museums, shopping centers..., meanwhile my personal feeling is get to this location by walking. the hotel has a very high speed wireless internet not free of charge but tangible. it is also isolate for external noises. its staff do their best to make you happy but the room is too small even for furniture inside! location of flat TV is too high in which it could not be visible. bath room is small and its arrangement make it more difficult in use.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, not so great hotel”
Reviews.Author: mosip
Reviews.Content: I don't want to be too harsh about the hotel, as I have no other in Amsterdam to compare this too. I am not fussy generally. The location was great as only a couple of minutes walk to all the action. But keep in mind this also makes this hotel extremely noisy, and it is on top of the train station. Our room was very small and clean, but uncomfortably hot, even though the window was open for 48hours and it was cold outside. It was hard to stay in the room. The staff were very friendly and helpful, and the breakfast was lovely - serving 6am-12pm. I don't think I would stay there again, as I like a room I can relax in.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, and A Very Good Hotel :) for a Short Break”
Reviews.Author: jonnyswoman
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I decided to go to Amsterdam about a month before we booked the hotel. I had read some of the reviews on here and as with anywhere you are going on holiday to, you accommodation is one of the most important aspects. I have to say I have not one bad word to say about the hotel , the staff or even the rooms. We did get what we paid for and enjoyed Amsterdam throughly. We were in B Tower. When we arrived we were given a room on the 8th floor meaning you had to change lifts which was not really a problem, I am a very light sleeper and had taken ear plugs with me because i had read on here that the hotel is beside the main central station. The room we were allocated was above the platform , in saying that the windows were double glazed and rooms insulated, so at night there way no noise at all! We had one of the rooms that over looked the platform and there was no one else beside us the other window looked out onto where the cruise liners left the harbour. It was beautiful and the view from the other window was out in front of central station where you could see all the trams and people going around. The room itself was very clean, our bed linen was changed at least three times during out 5 night stay and we were give clean towels every morning, The only think i would say was there was no kettle in the room, which we did think a bit strange, but in saying that the girl at reception gave us one. Coming from Northern Ireland we love out cups of tea and coffee :) The Hotel is very convenient to all of the Citys main entertainment areas, shopping and tourist attractions and is not located in some of the smaller streets around dam square which would be quite noisey at night. Every thing you need is on your door step, Trams, Central Station, Canal Cruises what more could you ask for. We chose the option of not having breakfast but in saying that you do not have to travel to far until you come across a cafe. It was one of the best stays i have ever had. We have stayed in other ibis hotels in london and Belfast. If you are looking for somewhere for a short break or even a weekend this is definately the place to stay and i would recommend it to anyone . The staff were most helpful too.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, great breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: felipecao
Reviews.Content: The room was very clean and size was ok (I mean, it's an Ibis, standard rooms, right?), although we got two single beds instead of the double bed we had reserved. The location is excellent, right by train station, at a walkable distance to all major sightseeing spots. The breakfast was awesome, lots of options for both food and drinks. The crew was kind and considerate. Wouldn`t stay anywhere else in A'dam.

Reviews.Title: “great location in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: coffeepot11
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, very clean, staff helpful. Room was small but adequate with good double glazing so no noise from station. Breakfast served til Noon - self service buffet, not a very wide range of food but adequate.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced for something so basic.”
Reviews.Author: cokebaby
Reviews.Content: We only spent one night at this hotel as we were passing through Amsterdam, and I'm glad. The location was only good if you are catching a train. The room was so close to the train platform that I could read the timetable boards from my window. I've stayed at plenty of basic hotels all over Europe, but this one made me feel like I was in a WWII era hospital room. The location may look convenient to downtown on a map, but there are plenty of better hotels at better locations for lower prices. Decent room for a one night turn around if you need to be close to the station, but don't make it your vacation hotel.

Reviews.Title: “NOISY! Avoid unless you are a trainspotter.”
Reviews.Author: ICAB0D
Reviews.Content: Expensive but basic, my only memories are of trains and flies! This hotel is built over the station platforms. From my window I looked into the carriages of trains at the passengers, approximately 10m away. The noise of the trains disturbed all of my colleagues who used this hotel. If you wish a good nights sleep try somewhere else. The hotel did everything possible to maximise their income on what was already a very expensive rate. Cleanliness of the ensuite facilities was below standard and there were small flies hovering around drains.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - ask for a room overlooking the harbour”
Reviews.Author: sandra_gronbech
Reviews.Content: Right next to the Central Railway station. Excellent reception staff - very helpful. The rooms on the harbour side of the extension give you wonderful views of the water traffic - we were there ( fortuitously) while the Tall Ships were in port! This building also spans over the railway tracks of the station so you can also watch the trains - may disturb some people.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but the room is small”
Reviews.Author: edison074
Reviews.Content: I choose this hotel because of the location next to the Amsterdam Central Station. I requested a twin bed room and was given the room at Block B Tower. I understand the Block B tower is better and the room looks clean and new. But I was a bit surprise that my room have 3 single bed hence, the room looks small. The room is equipped with Security box and the compliment free WIFI internet for 1 hours is given to hotel Guest. I requested the free1 hour internet when I checked out. Breakfast is optional for 15Euro and it is kind of expensive. Each day the same food is serve. I would recommend the hotel for it location.

Reviews.Title: “Good enough Hotel for short stay”
Reviews.Author: geordiemac9
Reviews.Content: We booked the Isis as part of a DFDS ferry deal, arrived quite early for our rooms so had to wait. My room , Tower A 4th floor, when we arrived, opened door and immy smelt cigarette smoke - it was from bathroom. Rang reception and had prompt service to rectify, was offered to be moved to another room, but would have to wait couple more hours, so stayed. Otherwise room very clean, beds good etc. Other family were given low floor room of choice and had no complaints. Breakfasts were good, plenty of choice re hot and cold meals, toaster was crap though. We chose this hotel for location/sightseeing. My only question was, if this room had been cleaned, who managed to smoke in bathroom before we arrived - no answer was given.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient for Central Station”
Reviews.Author: lincolnshireposy
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right next door to the station, in fact the breakfast room overlooks a platform. Brilliant for an easy transfer to and from the airport. It is completely non-smoking - important if you are a non-smoker, and was a big incentive for us as we hate so-called 'non-smoking' rooms that clearly aren't. Now for the downside - our room has to be the smallest I've ever had, even for the continent! We were constantly tripping over cases and each other, and the bathroom was so tiny you banged your elbow each time you moved! The room had a general cheap ambience - thin, hard carpet, bendy, plastic lightshades, tired, grubby woodchip walls. Our bathroom looked nothing like the ones in the photos - more like a men's public toilet - horrid tiles with grey grouting and mould over the shower. No shelf to put toileties and tiny, cheap thin towels. Although it looked clean, it had a grubby, manky feel to it. Definitely more hostel that hotel. However, the beds were comfy ( If narrow!) and the bedding felt clean and fresh. Overall, I would rate it just above an Etap but not even in the league of one of the shabbier Travelodges. A room to use as a functional base rather than a welcome retreat after a day in the city. My advice - you can do better!

Reviews.Title: “is ok”
Reviews.Author: Linnea_Quin
Reviews.Content: In general it is an average hotel to stay. Hygiene: Well, we first changed the room, because the bathroom didn't appear clean to me and my husband. It defiantly didn't look like a 80 Euro a night bathroom. You know, when mold starts to grow, it gets kind of pinkish around the bathroom tiles and in the corners of the shower. Well, this was what we got. We called the reception and moved to a different room. With no problems. The other room was better. The bed cheets were clean. The room was not shining, but it was alright. Service: Was good. Exactly what you expect. Location: The hotel is located directly above the train station. We stayed in the hotel last 2 days of our stay in Amsterdam. Our train departed early, so it was very convenient to get up just an hour earlier before the train departure and walk over to the train station. Besides of that, it is very close to all attractions (walking distance). Noise: If you are concerned about the noise from the train station - don't worry about that, you really don't hear anything. They took care about this problem by installing some special noise protecting windows. Our room was right above the train tracks and it was quite. The disadvantage of these windows is, that you can not open them. Smoking: If you hope to secretly smoke inside, you wont be able to. The entire hotel is a non smoking hotel (no smoking lounge) and as mentioned above, you cant open the windows. But you have an awesome option to smoke in front of the hotel. If you are the lucky SOB who gets a room at the 8th floor, good luck to you! You will first take the first elevator to get down to the 5th floor. From there you walk to the second elevator that takes you to the ground floor. At night, you will need to wait for the receptionist to get the doors open for you. View: If you are in the B TOWER, make sure you get a room with EVEN numbers. These rooms have a beautiful sea view. The rooms with uneven numbers have a horrible view of the opposite hotel tower. The bed: Well, lets say it this way: you neighbors will defiantly know what you are doing if it is not sleeping.There is no way, you can be quite in this bed! It is like in one of these bad movies . And.... it has these little wheels attached to the bed legs Those can be fun too All in all it is a good hotel to stay, but I would have expected a little bit more for the price. Since it is a non smoking hotel, I would have expected a smoking room in the hotel, so you don't need to go outside every time you want to smoke. The bathrooms could be a little bit cleaner and if you are really unlucky - you will have a horrible view out of your window. We had a better accommodation for a better price before.

Reviews.Title: “Basic but Clean Rooms”
Reviews.Author: annabanannaMelbourne
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights in July. Location is 100 metres walk from Central Station. Turn right as you exit the station, and look for the multi-level bicycle carpark! Rates were 109 euros per night. Check out is at 12pm, but you can pay 10 euros per hour to stay for longer. As suggested, we requested a room in Tower B and on a higher floor. The rooms had double glazing, but as the hotel is built directly over the train tracks, you will still be able to hear trains at night. The room was basic and no-frills. Very clean. Flat-screen TV has lots of channels. Bathroom is quite small. Hairdryer and shower gel are supplied. Free wifi is available in the lobby if you obtain an access code from reception. Location is very central. Trams and trains are no more than 5 mins walk away. Breakfast was 15 euros. There is an Albert Heijn supermarket just opposite the hotel (you need to cross the canal to reach it).

Reviews.Title: “Great Budget Option for a City Break”
Reviews.Author: Angelsrising
Reviews.Content: Situated right next to Centraal Station we got a triple room for three nights including 2 breakfasts included. It meant we didn't have to drag out suitcases across the city, we simply dropped them off and started out holiday. With three adults in the room there wasn't much room to swing a cat but it did the job for three tourists who needed somewhere comfortable to relax and sleep. It is probably a British thing but it would have been great if we'd had coffee making facilities. The lobby housed a selection of self serve hot drinks and snacks that were over priced but we got what we needed. I would suggest you get some water and snacks from a supermarket and keep them in your room. Breakfast was a selection of breads, fruit, yoghurt, scrambled egg, beans and mini sausages. Not exactly a cooked breakfast but you should find something you like. And the coffee was decent. Although right next to the station our sleep wasn't disturbed at all. Overall I would definitely stay there again - primarily for the location and price. Of course you could stay somewhere more atmospheric and boutique, but I came to see the city not the hotel,.

Reviews.Title: “If this hotel was a food, it would be a potato”
Reviews.Author: sam19771977
Reviews.Content: Reasonable price, reasonable rooms, reasonable view, reasonable service. If you're Mr Average on holiday you will love this place for its excellent averageness. I stayed in this hotel for nearly 3 months on a project here, 10-13 day stints. I almost went bananas. The bar has a menu with 4 main courses. 4. I suppose they worked out this is the average number of main courses in an average, average hotel. There are plenty of kebab shops and takeaways nearby, but restaurant wise Amsterdams pretty disappointing in my opinion. And I am always a sucker for room service. Only here its "nearly room service" where you order it by phone - CHECK - they cook it CHECK - then YOU go and get it - BEEEEEEP. FAIL. This just doesn't work. To get into the lift you have to insert your room card. How the hell can you do that carrying a tray full of food. You have to either balance it circus style in one hand or suffer the indignity of putting your food on the floor in a public area. Nice. On one occaison a member of staff begrudgingly helped me by opening the lift for me. He probably felt as stupid as he looked - why on earth could he not come with me in the lift and put the food in my room. Instead the hotel man stands watching the customer struggling with a tray. Somethings not quite right here is it .....? Breakfast is miserable. There's no other word for it. On the first day I stayed (of some 60-70 days) it was, average. Day 2. Average. Day 3. Getting a bit sick at the site of the teeny sausages and plastic scrambled egg with beans. Day 4. Dreaming of teeny sausages. Wake up in a cold sweat. Day 5. Cannot go near the breakfast room. Never want to again ever, ever. If only it looked like the pictures of the breakfast on the card in the room with smoked salmon and pretty girls. The wifi is expensive, considering its rubbish. One time it went extremely slow for a few days then stopped altogether. I called reception. Rather than say they would investigate, or look into it, or even "sorry about that sir" the dopey girl just says "We'll refund the money". Oh great. Thats a solution then. In a business hotel, in 2010, with no internet .... One tip - if you a thirsty when you come into reception area, there is a kind of snack bar type set up near the lifts. Except its so busy I frequently just drank a bottle of pepsi or whatever whilst waiting to buy my wifi voucher from reception. If you don't offer to pay they just assume you brought it in. Sometimes I even asked them to flip the empty bottle into their waste paper bin for me as a favour. Feels good.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location”
Reviews.Author: Aissum
Reviews.Content: We got a late deal through DFDS Seaways which included a two night stay at this hotel. It is in an ideal location with only a short walk to the main hustle and bustle of the centre but surprisingly quite at night. The rooms were clean and the staff very friendly. There was also a free breakfast which we were not expecting which included hot items such as scrambled egg, sausages and beans and your usual continental meats and cheeses as well. You are required to pay a Â£50 deposit when you arrive at the hotel saying that you wonâ€™t smoke in the rooms. You can see from the cleanliness of the rooms that they will enforce this. This is pretty much standard with most Amsterdam hotels due to the relaxed cannabis laws.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kpd862
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very nice and clean. Numerous things within walking distance. The wi-fi was extremely expensive but other than that, I have nothing bad to say at all. Would definitely stay there again. And they do allow pets.

Reviews.Title: “Just walk across from Central station...”
Reviews.Author: Anecdotal
Reviews.Content: Even as the room rates are not as attractive that you associate with IBIS, this is a very convenient hotel if you need to visit the city sights in a short time. After all, Amsterdam is a relatively expensive city as compared to other European cities. Its a two minute walk as you come out of the Amsterdam Central, and the city attaractions beckon. Check in to a comfortable room (surprisingly quite even as you are in the hub of action) , freshen up and get ready to explore the city without wasting much precious time in travelling to a hotel. The rooms overlooking the city centre makes you feel the pulse of this happening part of town- the (in)famous Red Light area , the small lanes, the canal ways, the trams, buses, the cafes and the eateries et al. And, the room packs in all the basics that you expect...

Reviews.Title: “Central location”
Reviews.Author: em1234
Reviews.Content: We stayed here last weekend and we had a very pleasant stay. The location right next to the train station is really good as you dont have to drag your suitcases through the cobbled streets! We were allowed into our room at 10am which was really nice after an early morning flight. The room was more than adequate for a short stay, and had a good shower and loads of UK TV channels. Our room was on the 3rd floor overlooking the city, and was quite noisy all night from the many people partying in the vicinity - but we left the window open as there was no air-con. Would definately stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean & Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: londonjp101
Reviews.Content: Typical Ibis, clean, basic and well presented. Stayed in a room over the train station, room was well sound insulated as never heard the trains. Obviously great location for the train station, 10 min walk into Dam Square.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient for train travelers”
Reviews.Author: PNW
Reviews.Content: As others have noted, the hotel is literally over the train tracks so you'll want to request a higher room in the newer wing. We were on the 6th floor and had no noise problems. Only connected with staff at check-in, but they were very pleasant and informative. The room is typical Ibis and was clean. The location is convenient if you're doing much train traveling, which we were. Didn't have breakfast at the hotel but got some decent-quality pastries and coffee at the station. We were using this as a jumping-off point for the train to Keukenhof, but on a previous trip to Amsterdam I preferred to be more in the heart of town. We walked (about 15 minutes to Dam Square), but you can also catch a tram or canal boat near the station. It's very convenient for getting to Schiphol airport--about 15 minutes by train. They do have a couple PCs in the lobby but be aware they're coin-operated. Keukenhof was spectacular but I did notice Amsterdam was much busier (and therefore less pleasant) than when we'd previously visited in September.

Reviews.Title: “Great cheap hotel.”
Reviews.Author: JoshKerry
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for the weekend while visiting Amsterdam. Its in an excellent location for sight seeing. We stayed in the 2nd block,I must say our room was excellent, the shower was fantastic and the whole service was brilliant. Its right next to central station so no messing around.

Reviews.Title: “Not too cozy, but in the city centre”
Reviews.Author: Douglas_SP_Brazil
Reviews.Content: This hotel is placed exactly on the Amsterdam city centre and it's beside the central rail station. I recommend to stay in this hotel only for this reasons. If you don't have to stay too much time of the day at the hotel and if you don't have to have your meals there, it would be a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Ibis Amsterdam Central Convenient but pricey”
Reviews.Author: DeltaScot
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for convenience, this hotel is, however prepare to squeeze into the tiny room and pay a price far in excess as to what you get . Asked for a double bed and got two twins. We had to move one bed to get the door open. Two cases and two people don't fit in the room at the same time. Staff was helpful and outgoing. Convenience not worth the added cost.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: TRAVELSMITHBRISBANE
Reviews.Content: I was upgraded to a superioer room with amazing views. Fantastic location

Reviews.Title: “Location 10+”
Reviews.Author: hannnsu
Reviews.Content: Location next to the railwaystation and near the city center was absolutely the best thing about this hotel. Staff was friendly and our room was nice and clean, a little small though. Even the hotel located in the center we weren't disturbed by any kind of noise or traffic in the nights. I have nothing negative to say about this hotel. I highly recommend :))

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: carlospadoa
Reviews.Content: Ibis hotels are known for having a very good cost / benefit relation. So I will concentrate my review in the location and not at what everybody already knows. Ibis Amsterdam Centre, as its name says, is in the center of Amsterdam. It is very close to the Centraal Station. Which is a very good thing. Even though the Hotel is very close to the train station, you can`t hear the trains. We have had very good night sleeps. The best thing about being near the centraal station, is that there are trains going to everywhere in the city, and coming from everywhere in the city. We didn`t even have to use the subway. You have lots of things at walking distance, including the red light district. This was a very important thing, because late at night there are less transportation vehicles. This was our first time in Amsterdam, and we`ve had an amazing stay thanks to the Ibis Amsterdam Centre.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean and functional”
Reviews.Author: milliemooandco
Reviews.Content: Right next to Central Station (the train tracks run through the towers of the hotel) and directly opposite the Canal Boat Trip Centre, the Ibis provided us with a convenient base for exploring the city. The entrance is almost obscured by the hundreds of bikes chained up around it. but the contemporary style foyer is well staffed and clean. We'd booked a double room and a twin for the children. On arrival, we requested adjacent rooms.The receptionist was very helpful and arranged adjoining rooms with a connecting door. The bedrooms were fairly small and had clearly been refurbished less recently than the reception areas. Wood chip wallpaper and very basic furnishings but clean and adequate for our needs.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - brilliant value.”
Reviews.Author: LolabelleScotland
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Tower B on the 6th floor facing out to the river and the trains, and were not disturbed by noise at all. In our room there was a hairdryer. I point this out as the lack of one has been a criticism in previous reviews! It's in the bathroom if you missed it. We had the free use of a safety deposit box too which was a bonus. Hotel was clean, beds were comfortable and the staff were friendly and helpful. Location is fantastic as all the buses, trams and underground will get you back to Central Station eventually and it is clearly marked and easy to locate on the route maps. Invest in a travel ticket - it covers all three services! Many attractions like the Anne Frank House and Dam Square are only 15 mins walk away. Only criticism was the breakfast. At 15 euros each it is a little steep for vending machine coffee and a very limited selection. Ours was inclusive but I would have grudged paying 45 euros for what we three ate. if not included in your deal, perhaps try the local cafes instead. Otherwise I recommend this hotel as a cheap, comfortable and central place for a city break.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient to the Central Station”
Reviews.Author: SBCATraveler
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel because it was near the Central Station, which was how we were arriving into Amsterdam. It is a 5 minute walk to the Ibis Hotel. We were greeted by a very friendly staff and checking into our room was interesting. I had requested when I made our reservation to have a room in Building B (the new building) due to reading reviews on TripAdvisor. When the front desk person gave us our keys to our room, I inquired to make sure the room was in Building B. When she said no it it in Building A, I said I requested Building B and at the same time my husband asked me, how do you know about Building B? I told him it was because of TripAdvisor. The front desk person, said "oh, TripAdvisor" let me see what rooms I have in Building B. After a few minutes, we had a room in Building B. The room itself was a little small, but very clean, new and comfortable. Our room overlooked the train tracks and we thought we would have a problem sleeping, but we did have any train noise. We did not eat at the hotel so we have no comment on the food. Our checkout the next morning was once again greeted by a friendly staff. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A clean, average hotel next door to the main railway station!”
Reviews.Author: MikeyGS
Reviews.Content: My friend & I decided to go on a weekend break to Amsterdam at the end of November 2009 and this was the hotel we stopped in during our stay. We were here for one night. OK, this hotel is in a good central location in Amsterdam, located bang next door to the main railway station. The rooms were clean, the staff were friendly enough and we got checked in pretty quickly when we arrived. I have to say that even though our room was overlooking the railway station, there wasn't much noise which came as a welcome suprise. Our room though was on one of the top floors so I cannot speak for rooms nearer to ground level. Even though the hotel is centrally located, you still have a bit of a walk before you manage to get to the 'main' attractions such as; Dam Square and Rembrandtplein. I think for the amount of walking we did, we easily notched up at least 8-10 miles over the course of 2 days, which gives you an idea of how big Amsterdam actually is. Also, Amsterdam is quite expensive, as was this hotel but I think this was as cheap as it was going to get in terms of a decent enough hotel for the night. Despite there being no problems with our room or the hotel generally, nothing really stood out for me, hence the 3 star rating I've given it. Don't take this as a bad thing by any means as this is an ideal place to lay your head for the night. In terms of food, we didn't eat any meals here so I'm unable to comment on it. Overall, a clean, average hotel in 'technically' the centre of Amsterdam with friendly staff and internet access in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - great location.”
Reviews.Author: poppypicanto
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights. Good hotel as long as you get a higher floor room, as our first room was on the 2nd floor overlooked by the trains, plus was noisy as room vibrated from the trains. Reception staff great and moved us to a room on 7th floor with view of the city and waters (all sorted within 30 mins). Rooms sufficient and clean, but some people may find small as per other reviews. Hotel extra's; such as drink are pricey or other items not available (for example: a can of fizzy pop out of the vending machine was 2.50) - Also WIFI at a cost and NO hair dryers for the girls, and also NO kettle if you want to make a hot drink (but you could get hot water from the lobby for e2.50) Saying that; we found Amsterdam really expensive anyway, compared to UK or other places. (We lived out off fast food because meals were too pricey in restaurants / diners) Overall, a decent hotel with a good central location for all the tourist spots and the train station (just make sure you get a room above the 3rd floor ideally).

Reviews.Title: “Wow those trains are noisy, other than that an ok place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: TownDrunk
Reviews.Content: I'll get to the point. This is a 3 star hotel. The staff is good but not great. The room was small but not to the point of being uncomftorable. Everything in the room was new and up to date and it all functioned well. The location is excellent. You can walk, get a bus, get a train, or a street car, it is all right outside the hotel doors. Don't let the Hotel call a taxi for you. The taxi company kicks back money to the hotel for the business and you will end up getting over charged. You are better off to call a city regulated taxi company yourself. Ask for a room that does not face the railorad tracks unless you want to stay up all night or at least half the night. The food they serve for their breakfast buffet is not worth 15 euros they charge for it, maybe half that price.

Reviews.Title: “Good price, great location, very comfortable bed”
Reviews.Author: Neadser
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights on a city break and paid â‚¬116 for double room per night which included breakfast. The location of this hotel is great. You can get the train from Schipol airport and it drops you a couple of hundred metres from the hotel. It overlooks the train tracks but the building must be very well insulated because you could not hear the trains. Rooms are an adequate size but not if you have a lot of luggage - we travelled light. Shower was great; bedroom / bathroom was spotless; bed was very comfortable and spacious. Do NOT forget to buy water outside the hotel as they charge â‚¬6 for 1.5 litre of water! Would definitely recommend this hotel for value and handy location. Don't get the charm you get with the boutique hotels but you pay for what you get - good value and spotlessly clean. Sinead, Dublin, Ireland

Reviews.Title: “brilliant location”
Reviews.Author: waterville
Reviews.Content: We were 3 females in our 30s and we booked a triple room here .we were on the 5th floor and over looked the harbour and some rail tracks. this hotel is actually integrated into centraal station. brill location, trams and canal cruises right outside central station.. room small, 2 single beds right beside each other and the other under the window, it was very comfy as i slept in this one but the sill does overlap a little so u could bang ur head if not careful. shower and all bathroom lovely but small, very clean, iron, tv not much storage for clothes thou esp for 3 people.. would def go back again and its perfect as a base for exploring Amsterdam..brekkie very good, loads hot and cold to choose from..

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what we needed for a short city break in an amazing city!”
Reviews.Author: domlikestravel
Reviews.Content: Like most of us, as my holidays and time out of the office are so precious to me, sometimes I think I spend more time on the internet looking for the best deal and comparing to reviews on tripadvisor than I actually spend away on my break! When looking into Amsterdam accommodation, it became very obvious to me that, being one of the more expensive European cities, it was going to be tricky to find somewhere decent to stay without breaking the bank. All I ever want is somewhere clean, comfortable, in a good location and good value for my money - and lo and behold, here it is, the Ibis in Amsterdam. The hotel is obviously really easy to find being just about Central Station, 20 minutes on the train, the third stop from Schipol Airport. You come out the station, turn right, walk 3 minutes and there the hotel is. Staying in a hotel near to Central Station ie. something that is always marked on the tourist direction signs and a focal point of the city was, at some points, an absolute godsend - it's very easy to get lost and disoriented in Amsterdam ;) It was also handy that it was near Central for morning coffee/croissant runs or to grab a drink or snacks before heading for your night's slumber. Check-in was welcoming and swift; after reading some of the reviews on here, I was worried about being put in one of the older rooms, however we thankfully got a room on the 8th floor in Tower B. The room itself was spotlessly clean and bright, perfectly functional for a short break in the city. I was amazed that we actually got a double bed, couples who regularly travel will be familiar with two beds pushed together scenario - not comfortable! And it was definitely bigger than a double and super comfortable with clean, fresh, cosy linen - though oddly three pillows? Bathroom, also spotlessly clean and bright, had a good/hot shower. Basin and loo - lots of towels and the usual complimentary little bottles of shampoo etc. The only gripe was that there was only the main light in the bathroom, not good if you need a night time visit to the loo - blinded! Check-out was again swift and friendly and they were happy to store our bags for a few hours while we did some more mooching around the city before our flight home. The hotel does have vending machines on every floor and coffee and snacks available in the lobby but we didn't really need them. There was also breakfast available for â‚¬15 each - very expensive so we didn't bother. The other thing to note is that the hotel is located over the train tracks - the rooms have double windows so you can hear train noise when one is open, but they are seriously sound proof when both are shut. Didn't hear a thing and we both slept like babies! Overall, if you're looking for a good value, clean, comfortable hotel in a great location, then book the Ibis. We got a great deal on their website at â‚¬175 for the two of us for two nights; obviously there is cheaper out there but from what I could tell this meant compromising on comfort. This is a chain hotel so if you're looking for a personal, BnB type service, this isn't the place for you. We were quite happy to be left to our own devises... and the telling test, we would stay there again! Amsterdam is an amazing city to mooch around in and enjoy doing nothing - it snowed when we were there, walking around the Canals in the snow was magical! Enjoy! (will add some photos later)

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: VlinderVlinder
Reviews.Content: It's a nice renovated hotel, next to Central Station in Amsterdam. The price is good for the quality you get. Only problem, if you have a room facing the trains then you will probably have a bid of noice. But the staff is very friendly and helpful. So you will have a great stay here

Reviews.Title: “TOP LOCATION - VERY GOOD BREAKFAST”
Reviews.Author: AAVMARMARIS
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel between 12 - 14 January 2010. First they gave me a room at the old building(A-Tower). The old style heating in the room was not working. I informed the reception and they immediately send some staff to the room to check it and my room was changed in 10 minutes. They gave me a room at the B-Tower, which is the new part of the hotel. At the B-Tower, the rooms are new and more bigger than the A-Tower(old part). My room was looking to the train station and a big water canal, so for somebody who likes trains it was very interesting. There were vendor machines at every floor, so drinks and some small snacks can be taken from these machines. Also water, tea, snacks, coffee and some fruits are available at a desk near to the reception, against payment. 1,5 liter water costs 6.-Euro there... Breakfast is excellent...Anything you need was there at the buffet, including smoked salmon fish...Very fresh breads and nice croissants, Reception staff was friendly and very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish, suberb location and great value for money”
Reviews.Author: Bo2red
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated right next to the central station only a 5 minute walk from Dam Square and the shops etc. The hotel has 24 hour reception and bar for snacks along with vending machines on each floor. It has a restaurant and internet access. Breakfast is open from 4am until 12pm for those who like to rise early or like a late breakfast. The rooms are small but meet your needs, with a flat screen tv with lots of channels and views are amazing from most windows, only slight downfall is there is a bike park by the hotel, but causes no problems. The hotel overall is clean, the staff are friendly and helpful and i would recommend to anyone who is thinking of staying in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money, comforty, just what you need for short break”
Reviews.Author: walker0702
Reviews.Content: We went for mine and my girlfriends 2 year anniversary, we just wanted a short break, different scenery and somewhere to lay our heads at night where it was comfy and clean, and this was what we got at the Ibis hotel. It was more than enough space for the pair of us. lovely washroom, massive shower, and was very clean, as was the whole hotel for the two nights that we spent there. Especially good location as was situated right on the main road - Damrak, everything was within a 5 minute walk. And we found one of the cheapest hotels this close to the main road. Quite close to red light district too, and about 20mins walk from Anne Franks house, which was in pleasant scenery anyways. We arrived at the hotel just after half 9, on the Saturday morning, and was able to leave our suitcases in the locked up luggage room until we wished to check in, no charge, and you needed a swipe card to get into this room, we checked in at just before 2 and was done in a matter of minutes, we given two swipe cards and again to use the lift you had to have one of these cards. When entering room was greeted by light airy spacey room, we had emailed about a week before we went if we were able to be put in the newer part of the building and we were. we would recommended you doing this just in case. Both mornings the room was cleaned, and fresh towels, had no worries about leaving our belongings in the room. there was also a safe free of charge that we could use etc. On leaving again we asked if we could use the luggage locker and again no problem, no charge, everything was no trouble for the staff. Fabulous language skills and were very fluent in all languages, English, french etc as well, and extremely helpful if you needed the right direction. To sum up, brilliant hotel with nothing too much trouble from the staff. Room clean, tidy, and fresh, for somewhere to rest up for a short break. and our room we experience no trouble with the trains below, barely could hear them with window shut. Only small not even a criticism just a request - would be a kettle, because no where seems to have a nice cuppa tea. Value for money as we only booked about 6 weeks before we went, and fast reply when emailing them. Very happy customers.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Friendly, Spacious.”
Reviews.Author: chezan
Reviews.Content: We were greeted by friendly, efficient staff at the reception desk. The room was on the seventh floor in the new tower and had wooden floors, a spacious bathroom with large corner cubicle shower and hairdryer, large well lit mirror, and lots of towels. The bedroom had a TV, corner seating area and chair with desk and long wide windowsill, open plan wardrobe, lots of shelves, twin beds, and safe! Everything was clean, and when we asked the room maid in the corridor, for an extra pillow, it was provided immediately with a smile and "sleep well". There was some noise from the trains, but we like to sleep with the window open, and with it closed, there is no noise at all. The self service breakfast was a choice of juices, breads, cheeses, boiled eggs, sausages, beans, cooked meats, fresh fruit, cereals. Tea & Coffee was also self service and was ok, except that the Latte was sweet when I reached halfway down the cup, although I hadn't added any sugar. After asking, we took two bananas out with us each morning, and this was no problem. Breakfast is served until noon and checkout is also noon, we left our cases in the secure room after breakfast and returned later, we were asked our name and room number before the door was unlocked for us to retrieve them. We will certainly stay again, the location is excellent and our stay was most pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: PutraYogyakarta
Reviews.Content: the hotel service is nice, however, the quality of food should be improved.

Reviews.Title: “Functional hotel with helpful, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: SimonLeedsEngland
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel direct and got a very good rate at 87 euro for a double room (without breakfast) for one night. The hotel is very well placed being on the doorstep of the train station and a 5-10 minute walk to Dam Square. We arrived very early for check in (10am) not expecting to get a room so early but we got straight in and our request for a quiet room was greeted with two options floor 3 or floor 7. We chose floor 7 and from here could not here the trains that some reviews mention. The room was small and basic but for a one night stay was more than adequate having en suite shower room, tv and small desk. We had forgotten to pack a travel adaptor, a quick call to reception and we were loaned one (no charge just hand back on check out). We did not eat at the hotel so cannot comment on that side of things. On checking out we asked if we could leave our cases for the day as our flight back was not until the evening - no problem there is a secure luggage room. All in all a very pleasant stay in what is a budget price hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: GOM99
Reviews.Content: This hotel is ideally placed for a short visit to Amsterdam. It is next to, indeed some of it is over, the main railway station with ready access to the excellent tram, metro and bus network of the city. The tourist office is close by (if you want to get an Amsterdam Card â€“ which are good value â€“ order on line and pick it up at the office â€“ there is a special queue for this which saves much time!). The dÃ©cor etc. are typical Ibis but the rooms are bit a smaller than others I have used â€“ but more than adequate for a short stay. Breakfast is good and there is a restaurant with limited menu. You can also buy (expensive) snacks and water 24/7. A better bet here is to use the supermarket or fast food outlets in the station.

Reviews.Title: “depends on which part of the building your room is”
Reviews.Author: sidnae
Reviews.Content: After extensivly viewing trip advisor on this hotel, I realsied I would need to request a room in the 'new part' of the building when making my booking. The booking department put a note on their system so when I check in the hotel staff can accomodate, however, I checked in around 11pm and was quite dissapointed that the staff had not taken this into account earlier and had given away all the rooms in the new part of the buliding. I was given a double room in the old part of the bulding, and promised if I came before 12 the following day I could change rooms. The first room was terrible, 2 single beds pushed together to make a double, with 2 single blankets (I even fell through the bed in the middle). The bathroom was disgusting, not like a typical ibis with a cubicle shower, the shower was tiled with a manky shower curtain. Also, the room was very small. The next morning I complained to reception when I asked to be moved to the newer part of the building, and after an hour they rang back offering a VIP room! This room could not have been better, wooden floors, spacious bathroom (big cubicle shower), and very good view, plasma TV and huge comfy double bed, hairdryer and safe! For this reason I definatly think you need to request a room in the new part of the building-mainly for the bathroom as its much more modern. I was given a VIP room so I'm not too sure what the standard rooms in the new part of the building are like, but from other reviews they look good. Would probably not book this hotel again, its a risk if your not given a room in the new part of the building. My stay would have been awful if I had to stay in the first room. Can't complain about the location, close to dam square and the coffee shops.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Modern”
Reviews.Author: LeeKent
Reviews.Content: After staying at so many poor hotels in Amsterdam I had a real surprise staying at the Ibis. I booked an early saver direct on their website for 97 euros per night for two people and requested a high floor to which we were given the top floor. The staff are ultra efficient, friendly and helpful. The standard of the room was excellent, very clean and modern. Flat screen TV, air con, comfortable bed and large shower. I really couldnâ€™t find fault and with the location being right next to central station with everything in walking distance you canâ€™t really go wrong.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but with a downside”
Reviews.Author: sergio2008
Reviews.Content: This Ibis hotel is right in downtown Amsterdam, adjacent to the Central Station. It has two towers, with one built over the railway tracks. At the end of the tower built over the railway tracks are a few rooms where the view is of the trains "disappearing" below you/the building, this is a neat thing if you like watching railway activity. I had one of these rooms, the number was 686 if I remember well. Others have commented about noise from the railway, I did not hear any significant noise and believe the hotel (or at least the part I was in) is well insulated, however when straining one's ear it is possible to hear some train noise. It is not sufficient to be disturbing to most people I think. The room size is typical Ibis, others have commented saying the rooms were small, I found my room of "normal Ibis size" - the size most rooms at modern purpose-built Ibis hotels are. Sufficient space, but yes opening a big suitcase on the floor takes up much of the free floor space in the room. The bed was typical Ibis too - firm and comfortable, the bathroom had a lot of light as is also typical of (newer) Ibis hotels and which is nice. Due to its location most of the city tourist areas can be walked to easily from the hotel, which makes it a good place to stay for a few days in Amsterdam. Another good thing about the location: no need to take a taxi from Schiphol airport, simply take the train at the airport for a few Euros and 15 minutes later or so you arrive at Amsterdam Centraal station and you are just a few minutes walk away from your hotel. The hotel has a restaurant and bar, however which I did not use due to the proximity of so many other restaurants and bars in the nearby streets. There are also snack and drink vending machines in the hotel lobby. Staff at the hotel I found very friendly. One big downside of this hotel is the in-room wireless Internet access: whilst hotels across the world increasingly provide Internet access for free as part of the package (after all it is a necessary utility, not a "luxury service"), Accor in most locations seems to go counter to this trend and still charges a fairly outrageous price in my opinion - if I remember well it was EUR 19.95 for 24 hours access. This access was provided through a commercial third party (T-Mobile). So when considering this hotel, remember that the final price is not what you see on the booking: you will probably need to add a significant amount for Internet access. At other hotels including in downtown Amsterdam this is often free, so make sure to compare apples with apples. Overall conclusion: a typical Ibis, clean, efficient and new, at a very central location. However the "hidden cost" of added Internet access can make it significantly more expensive than it looks at first sight.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location”
Reviews.Author: sergio_paro
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very well located, a 50 m walking from the Central Train Station. The room size is smaller compared to the IBIS I am used in the south of Brasil.

Reviews.Title: “Good and convenient hotel”
Reviews.Author: lovesweets2
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Ibis Center after reading the good reviews of this hotel. I got attracted to this hotel due to it's location - just next to Central Station. From Schipol airport, we took the train to our hotel. Between myself, my husband and our 12 yrs old son, our train ticket cost 13 Euro for the 3 of us compared to if we take the taxi, it would have cost us 45 Euro. The train ride was good. Each stop gives you ample time to take your luggage down from the train. Imagine us with 3 large luggage and 2 carry-on. The hotel is clean with decent size rooms. It is walking distance to the canal bus, the Red Light district and Chinatown. Breakfast is simple but good. There is a variety of bread, hot food (scrambled eggs, sausages, boiled egg & hot baked beans), cereal, fruit, condiments, butter, coffee and juice. For lunch and dinner, I suggest to venture around chinatown as they offer a buffet lunch or dinner for 8-9 Euro.

Reviews.Title: “adequate”
Reviews.Author: paulreith
Reviews.Content: stayed in the ibis with my wife, daughter and son in law for 2 nights 01-03 august. we paid 196 euros per couple for the 2 double rooms, this did not include breakfast.while the rooms were spotlessly clean and of a good size, we thought that at this price we should have had tea and coffee making facilities and a hair dryer in the room. staff were 2pleasany and helpful. dont believe the claim to a 24hr bar service on the website as the bar closes at 1.00am. beers can be purchased from a cooler after this time, all in all we enjoyed our stay and would go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel at perfect location. Grab a room here if it's not booked”
Reviews.Author: misterlar
Reviews.Content: I really like the Ibis chain rooms, and thankfully this is no exception. Great rooms at reasonable prices (especially when booked in advance). Located right next to the Central Station, the hotel is actually in two parts (with a walkway over the tracks to the other part). I was given a room on the 9th floor in the back section, but was totally happy. Room was quiet, spotless clean, has everything I need. No complaints at all. Just two warnings that apply to all Ibis hotels: (1) if you don't want breakfast (E10-E15 fee more), even if you're already pre-paid, and even if you'd told them you don't want breakfast, you have to tell them AGAIN at CHECKOUT you haven't had it, because they automatically add it to your bill. It will even print "Breakfast: YES" on the checkin card (even if you haven't paid for it and it's not included) because the default is that the customer wants breakfast and will pay for it. So you just have to tell them at checkout that you haven't had it and make sure they're not charging you for it. (2) Ibis hotels charge you for the telephone just for an outside line (even if it's a toll-free 0800 number). So not just for local or long distance calls, but even for normally toll-free "800" or "0800" numbers, there's a charge for them. Keeping these two things in mind though, I really like the Ibis chain. I was able to get E50 rooms here pre-booking, and was totally happy in all ways with this place. Would definitely stay here again. Great rooms, great staff, perfectly central location that can't be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Ibis: good hotel close to all the action”
Reviews.Author: Jules078
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at the Hotel Ibis Centre July 23 to 30 and August 3. This hotel is perfect as it is right next to Centraal Station and in the middle of the action (RLD, the main strip, shopping, etc.) The rooms are small but functional...doesn't matter because you are only there to sleep, shower and change. Breakfast was good - croissants & breads with various spreads, fresh fruit, coffee, tea, yogurt, eggs (that looked questionable), sausage and baked beans. In a few reviews that I read, it was mentioned that it was noisy because of being so close to the train station. The only time I heard the train was if I was in the breakfast room or in Centraal Station. The only noise I'd hear from the room, were ppl chatting and that was because the window was open. A few reviews said that the hotel staff were rude and not friendly. I'm not sure who they were referring to but the hotel front desk and breakfast staff we had were AWESOME. Thanks to Ina, Nancy, Lynn, Liesbeth, Victor and Shalis. Whenever they would see us, it was always "Hello Miss, how are you?". They were very helpful, accommodating and friendly. They certainly made our stay very enjoyable. The food in Amsterdam is good! You can never say that you don't know what to eat or that you don't want to have the same thing twice (unless you really liked it).
