We enjoyed Chinese food, Argentinian food, Turkish Schwarma (lamb and turkey - it was delicious), good pasta in Centraal Station at a place called Julia's Pasta, the best fries I've ever tasted were at Mannekin Pis (Belgium fries) and the schnitzel was GOOD! Love it. Would I stay at this hotel again? Most definitely.

Reviews.Title: “good value of maney”
Reviews.Author: vatajelud
Reviews.Content: good position, clean and corect. Not luxury. Safe zone. good breakfest

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel I have every stayed”
Reviews.Author: turgra
Reviews.Content: Imagine arriving in Amsterdam after 15 hours of flight to be received by one of the worst experiences in the world. This is the Ibis Centre Amsterdam. First the rooms are smaller than a cruise room you dont even have enough space to put your bags, you get one little window that wont even open to get some fresh air and the bathroom is so small you can barely shower in there. The bed is so unconformable that you will wake up 10 times a night because the bed just wont stop moving. The Ibis hotel is a 100% non smoking hotel, if you smoke the first time they charge you 50 Euro, the second time they throw you out but they dont tell you any of this when you check in. We were 12 friends traveling together and we had 4 rooms for 3 persons each. We were supposed to stay for 6 days but after the second day we all checked out. At check out they wanted to charge me more than 100 Euros, 50 Euro for smoking in the room and 50 Euro more because they said that the blanket had ashes on it and that they would have to clean them so I guess they dont usually wash their sheets and the real penalty for smoking in your room would be 100 Euro really. I would strongly recommend to stay in better located hotels closer to Dam Square like the NH Krasnapolski were they have a great service or the Swissotel and Golden Tulip which are also very good. If you are staying at the Ibis Center better dont go to Amsterdam at all, you will not get what you payed for. I will never go near the Ibis even if they pay for my accommodations and include my breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “disappointed in several areas”
Reviews.Author: blustein2
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel using their web site in dollars and they charged me more money in euros. They also promised a/c which just blew warm air. When I complained they stated that this was the best they could offer. I asked upon checking in if using a calling card would result in any additional charges. Although they said no, it did result in 20 additional euros being charged to my account. They do have a promise on their web site which stated that if you are not satisfied your money will be refunded. As of yet, I have not heard from them. For almost $200 a night, I expected more. The location was good.

Reviews.Title: “OK room in central location close to train station.”
Reviews.Author: THED0CT0R
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with friends on a lads escape to Amsterdam. Its a good central location in Amsterdam close to the Central Rail Station so once you collect your luggage at the Airport - just catch the train into town and the hotel is not even 3 minutes walk away. The staff were generally great. The room was clean and functional. It was a good base to go out and explore Amsterdam. I would recommend using the trams to get about. It is worth doing a canal boat trip. The Hieniken Experience was good too ! There are some good Argentine Steak Houses about too !

Reviews.Title: “Just ok”
Reviews.Author: Billy92
Reviews.Content: Not enough people mention the disruption the trains have on their stay. I stayed with a group and the Hotel is built over the trainlines. The screeching can be heard all night long. I got to sleep for about 4 hours. The Hotel itself is functional and location is good but there is no way I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient to train station”
Reviews.Author: Tempe_Sun_Devil
Reviews.Content: Hotel IBIS is sleek, modern, clean and right next door to Amsterdam Central train station. I would only reccommend this hotel for a one night stay if you need convenient access to the train station. Otherwise, it is expensive and generic.

Reviews.Title: “absolutely no frills”
Reviews.Author: ashspark
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel due to it's good location. It really has a very good location just next to Amsterdam Central Station, so you can just pull your luggage along the road and be at the hotel in 5 minutes. However as other reviews stated, the room is really small. I've never stayed in such a small hotel room, with such a small shower area. The toilet in my room was so small that a normal sized adult would have difficulty being comfortably seated there. There is no kettle or tea making facilities. I brought my own, but forgot to bring cups. There is no hair dryer (maybe need to request from reception). There is a wireless hotspot which can get you the internet usage for about 5 eur for one hour's use. Breakfast was ok but costs 15 eur. I'd recommend this place only if one doesn't feel claustrophobic in very small rooms. Wouldn't recommend the breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “When a centraal location with a view is important, this is it.”
Reviews.Author: Thejoyisinthejourney
Reviews.Content: After staying at a trendy AMS hotel at the beginning of our trip, we wanted a real bathroom and centraal location. The IBIS Centraal is perfict. Just a few paces from the Centraal Station, we had booked a great on-line rate and the luck of the draw gave us a river/train station view. The breakfast room was wonderful and the food quite nice. Our maid was shocked when I tipped her for an extra pillow. Our room was spotless from the moment we checked in! It is the equivalent of an American Holiday Inn/Ramada/Best Western, a good clean place to stay in a convenient location.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap Hotels”
Reviews.Author: PrateekN
Reviews.Content: The hotel is perfect for travelers. The hotel has a good breakfast, small rooms and perfect location. I picked up the hotel for reason i didnt want to pay much on the hotel and spend more time outside the hotel. The rooms are very small and u would have a problem for keeping your luggage also. Pefect for people who want to just sleep and move out and look around. You have a good breakfast deal.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel Next to the train station”
Reviews.Author: bulldog44
Reviews.Content: we stayed here for 2 nights As part of our European vacation. The hotel is directly next to the train station so its very convenient to hop on any tram to go anywhere in the city but the area in front of the station is very busy. There is lots with in walking distance. The red-light district is about a 10 min walk and there are many shops, cafes and restaurants close by. The main tourist office is right across the street. They were very helpful in booking tours for museums and recommending restaurants. We purchased the I Amsterdam card witch we got full use out of. The hotel was clean but the rooms were simple and smallâ€¦like most in Europe. We spent very little time at the hotel. Breakfast was included and probably one of the best during our trip. We also went to Munich, Paris, and Florence. There were many breads and meats, eggs, sausage, yogurt and more. I would recommend this hotel to a traveler who is on the go and looking for a good value.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION for Train travellers”
Reviews.Author: alinaSanFrancisco
Reviews.Content: This 3-star hotel is well-situated next to the Centraal train station which made it very convenient for us train travellers. The area is likewise the main stop for the city trams and buses so going around the city with a map is never a burden. My only gripe was they made us wait... We arrived at 1 PM and we're told to wait until 2 to check-in. We had to stay in the lobby, tired, as other tourists were queuing at the reception to get a room. When 2 PM rolled around, we weren't even notified and my husband had to fall in line again to check for room availability. We were then given a room at the 5th floor of their new building just above the train tracks. The room was small as can be expected esp for 3 people but had basic necessities and was clean. The noise from the passing trains can be a bother for light sleeper like me especially since we had to open the windows at night to bring in cool air. Our 2-night stay was un-expectedly warm (maybe the hotel's central heating system is on) and the aircon was unfortunately not working. However, the buffet breakfast which was included in the rate was very good. They got a wide selection of hot (sausages, scrambled eggs, beans) and cold food choices as well as juices and coffees. Internet access was not free and it's 22 euros for 24 hours. There's an internet station at the lobby near the restaurant for a fee. Over-all, our stay was good although I'd prefer a cooler room. Nonetheless, I'd still consider staying at this hotel if I visit Amsterdam again. Recommended for people who are not too picky...

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: kevmcc
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights with my girlfriend. The hotel is located next door to the train station, and close to many of Amsterdam's attractions. We arrived slightly early, but were able to check in and go to our room straight away. The room was a typical Ibis room, small but clean and tidy. The bathroom was also quite small, but big enough to turn around in. The room was quite noisy through the day, as a result of the traffic outside. However, at night I didn't hear anything. Most of Amsterdam is within walking distance of this hotel. The staff all speak English, and the breakfast buffet was a fantastic cure for my hangover!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good value - clan modern efficient”
Reviews.Author: Tripper21
Reviews.Content: I like Mercure Hotels. They always seem to have a goo MIX of features, to someohow offer better value than most other places. This IBIS is in a perfect location, next door to Amsterdam Centraal, but still offer good value at EU102 including breakfast. Try and find that in central Londen!! Very modern and efficient downstairs reception areas and first floor breakfast room. Rooms a little small, but OK. Wifi is not free, but is very good value compared to most other Hotels. recommended

Reviews.Title: “A little bit of hell in central Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: RunningDogYankee
Reviews.Content: Because of my company's travel policy for some reason I am forced to stay at this infernal establishment every time that I transit through Amsterdam. One shouldn't expect too much from a hotel chain that depends upon volume of tourist traffic in an already over touristed city, but this particular place sets the bar so low that it rates its own review for nastiness. Example: you arrive at 8:00 in the morning, jet lagged from an intercontinental flight to be greeted by a singularly unsympathetic reception staff. All you want is a room to sleep, but their policy says 12:00 check-in and not a minute earlier. You ask them to see if anything is available. They say, "no" and you are told to wait in the lobby (still under construction) and that you will be called if anything opens up. Dozing off as hordes of budget tourists are checked in on an inefficient but industrial basis, you notice that some of them are actually being given rooms before the check in time. You want to ask about this, but you have to queue in a long line. When you finally get to the reception, the unsmiling staff member says "no availability". You go onto the cold streets of the city and nurse a cup of coffee somewhere in a sleep deprived daze, then you return at noon. To retrieve your bags you have to climb over a small mountain of luggage and there is nobody to help you (except maybe thieves). You finally check into a small cubicle laughably called a "room", but you don't care - you just collapse into a coma. Then you are woken by reception asking to check some credit card detail. At this point, you swear never to check into this hotel again or else vow to quit your job. If you've ever seen the horror movie "1408" you'll get the idea... AVOID THE IBIS CENTRAL (next to the Centraal Station) and get a room at one of the numerous smaller hotels that are abundant in central Amsterdam. They could not be worse and are certainly cheaper!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel and nice Location”
Reviews.Author: Quark23
Reviews.Content: This was the third time i stayed in Amsterdam, and this Ibis Hotel was the best of all the hotels i used to stay in Amsterdam. The Ibis label stands for quality. We arrived late on friday the 13th of February 2009 (7h50 PM) but that didn't gave problems. The room was in another building connected with a covert bridge. There were vendingmachine placed so people could get a snack or a drank, near the reception there also was a 24h shop to buy soda etc.... The room was clean and cool (you could use the Airco to look for the correct temperature. The bathroom was large (large shower, i believe you could even wash your Amsterdam bike in it. A downside was the lack of room between one of the beds and the bathroom. But i can live with it. Breakfast was BTW great, it was a buffet and you could go several times to take some more.

Reviews.Title: “This was a pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: Jasonusf
Reviews.Content: Amsterdam was the third stop on my wife and my tour of western Europe. I paid $85 Euro per night which included breakfast. Assuming you will arrive via train, there isn't a better location for you. This hotel is central to the canal tours and the major shopping district. The front desk was courteous and responsive. I was surprised to get such a nice hotel for such a reasonable rate. The hotel restaurant is a bit pricey, but there are cheaper alternatives nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Stinky room, no heating, great location and good breakfast”
Reviews.Author: hrgdavor
Reviews.Content: As the title says... I agree with others that the location is great, besides the access to city center, the great thing is that is so close to train. My meeting was in Rotterdam (1 hour by train) but trains are frequent so I did not leave too much time to get to the meeting on time. The airport is a 10 minute ride. My problem was that the heating wasn't working and I caught a cold. Another minus was the room that smelled stale, and smelled a lot. The smell did not go any better after leaving the window open a whole day. Another plus was the breakfast, it was not spectalurar or anything, but was very nice

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Location...but tatty!”
Reviews.Author: BedfordPI
Reviews.Content: I am quite laid back when it comes to hotels, but was shocked at the poor level of service here at the Ibis. Because there was a mix up - they thought we hadn't paid for one of our rooms - check-in took 45 minutes! It turned out they had made a mistake, but I am sure that there was something they could have done to make this less painful! The rooms are very pokey - a twin means 2 singles pushed together as there is no space, there is a heater on the wall in the bathroom making it difficult to use the loo, and there was mould on the bathroom ceiling! When we got back to the hotel at 3am the room was freezing cold! There is a vent on the wall that blows in cold air 24/7, which is impossible to turn off and it is opposite the bed (both of us returned home with a cold)! We turned on the heater - which also just blew out cold air!!!! There is a '15 minute guarantee' meaning that they fix all problems within 15 minutes - that's a joke!! I asked reception to fix the heater - he said NO, I asked for a spare heater, he said NO. I asked what he could do and he said I don't know. Hmmm... I asked for 2 extra duvets, which someone else brought up promptly - nobody ever fixed the heater. Whatever you want from reception will cost you - even a Â£5 travel adaptor costs a 20 euro deposit! Breakfast was ok but quite limited considering the cost - 2 types of cheese, 4 types of meat, the same sausage, scrambled egg and beans every day, 2 types of cereal, 1 type of yoghurt and about a 5 types of bread! Some variety from day to day would have been nice It is a shame that the hotel is so poor as it is just a 5-10 min walk from the dam square and so convenient, but i will not be staying again!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Expensive”
Reviews.Author: wise_lily
Reviews.Content: The hotel was under construction when I stayed there, so very noisy during the day, as I checked in in the morgning, impossible to get a rest. Didn't even get a reduced price for that! Well located, clean, bathroom could be nicer but ok, staff is ok, poor breakfast (because of the construction works, it was given in the hallway of each level). Overall I found it very expensive for the offered service. (179 EUR!/night)

Reviews.Title: “Safe bet and worked out fine”
Reviews.Author: evelyndevlin
Reviews.Content: Because we booked a bargain on a no-refund basis, we could not get a refund when we could not turn up for one of our two nights. But that's not the hotel's fault! Location great, staff friendly and helpful . Hotel looks good with nice looking bar. Got room on 7th floor with great view. Small but clean with everything working well. No tea or coffee making in room. Breakfast okay and plentiful but no toast facilities or bacon/fried eggs. Nice eating area. Would have no hesitation in going there again, though we did see some more interesting looking hotels on our travels through Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location for this upmarket Ibis”
Reviews.Author: WhiteAnt2008
Reviews.Content: The hotel is so close to the station that it actually straddles two of the station platforms - its a little odd to eat your breakfast with train passengers watching you from a few metres away. The hotel has a different feel to many Ibis hotels - I believe it has expanded significantly in recent months. I had an issue that was possibly down to a misunderstanding, and was impressed that the hotel manager gave it personal attention, and invoked the hotel's service guarantee. I also saw excellent service from the Accor helpline who I contacted regarding this issue - rapid response, and a willingness to own the issue through to resolution - not something you find with many hotel chain customer service teams. My only complaint was the price of breakfast - 14 euros - obviously this seems worse for those of us translating the price into UK pounds, but I'd expect something special for that price. The good news is that the station is so close you can get supplies from there if you want to do your own thing.

Reviews.Title: “No frills; Great location”
Reviews.Author: Vitz6
Reviews.Content: Typical Ibis hotel - safe standard hotel. No frills but great location being a 30 second walk from Grand Central Station. Room was small but not a real issue for us only staying 2 nights. Room had great view into Amsterdam town though. Hot breakfast didnt have has browns or bacon so a bit disappointing for full english breakfast lovers! Canal Bus hop on hop off tour stop right in front of central station.

Reviews.Title: “An Old Favourite”
Reviews.Author: IanKate
Reviews.Content: I booked into the Ibis beside the Centraal Station in Amsterdam from 20/27 December 2008. I have stayed there many times (about 20!) and usually go back mainly because of its location: it's beside the terminuses for the tramcars, buses and boats and a very short walk across a bridge to a great shopping street that leads down to the palace. First, the gripes: As a journalist I use my laptop a great deal and they charge â‚¬25 a day which is a ridiculous price and would have come to â‚¬175 for the week. Fortunately, my regular coffee shop has a number of computers with Internet connection and I worked from there every day for about one or two euro per hour. Also, the service in the restaurant at the Ibis is very, very slow, although the food was excellent when it eventually came. Talking about restaurants, I can highly recommend the Silveren Spiegel - a few minutes walk from the hotel - and also The Five Flies (that's the name!) further down the Spuistraat. Both are expensive. The best kept secret in Amsterdam is a restaurant IN the railway station (on platform 2b) and about 2 minutes walk from the Ibis. It's like something out of an Agatha Christie novel, with the waiters dressed in black with white aprons, fine decor in an eastern style (the oak double linenfold panelling around the restaurant is of superb quality), and a large white parrot or cockatoo - sometimes noisy - called Elvis, on the service counter. Don't get too near him as he might be in one of his moods! The food is excellent and very reasonably priced. I can especially recommend the steaks and wiener schnitzels for dinner, while the Dutch stews are the best value for lunch anywhere. I go there every day (it took me about 3 years staying at the Ibis before I found the place in its most unlikely situation) and is another good reason for staying at the hotel. Say "hello" to Dino the Libyan waiter from me if you go there. The Ibis Hotel is also handy for the shops in the station, especially the small supermarket, the chemist's, and the stationery shop. There is also a good Information Centre on platform 2 where you can buy various travel tickets for a week or so and get pamphlets on what's going on in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Location!”
Reviews.Author: JimyDavid_8
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this Hotel many times. The Location next to Amsterdam Central train station is ideal. Also most of the Trams originate here, so you can travel to all parts of the city from the front door. The staff is professional and helpful. The rooms can be a bit small for extended stays, but, all in all quite adequate in the short term. The Hotel and rooms are clean and good security is apparent, throughout. The breakfast was fine, if its included with your price, but 14 Euros, seems a little expensive to me. Will stay here again on my next visit to Amstersdam. l

Reviews.Title: “cenral location”
Reviews.Author: avid
Reviews.Content: A good location easy to walk to the cities attractions, very recently had a new reception and bar and work was still ongoing. Bedrooms very modern with a lovely shower. Breakfast was buffet style and adequate. Walk up prices were expensive and I witnessed people being told the price and walking away so best to book via the ferries etc.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: plane766
Reviews.Content: Staff are friendly and helpful. Really close the Main train station but I paid almost Euro 200 a night not worth at all. What I get is a room like a bird cage.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in the city centre”
Reviews.Author: TouristDrachten
Reviews.Content: We really loved our stay in this hotel. The hotel is just renovated and the room was great, with a view over the water. Also the restaurant and the bar looks great, before we went to town we had a drink in the bar. Breakfast is served until 12.00 o'clock ! The staff of this hotel is very friendly and helpfull.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Canadian_Flames
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got back from our two week honeymoon where we stayed at the Hotel Ibis Centre for one week. We both loved this hotel. The customer service was excellent. Everyone we encountered at the front desk were very helpful and welcoming. One gentleman, not sure of his name, helped my husband find where we could rent a scouter and where we may park it over night. The room was larger than I expected which was nice. The bed was a bit to firm for our liking but still comfortable. The bathroom was clean and very nice. A little cramped when you get two people in it getting ready in the morning but still nice. The one thing both my husband and I loved about the hotel was that it is right beside the train station. Okay really on top of it. But you do not hear the trains that much. Ask for a room above floor 5 and your will be fine. I would absolutely rebook this hotel on future trips and will recommend it to others too. One suggestion though... There is a lot of bikes outside of the hotel, because of a bike parking lot, so be careful when walking to the sidewalk.

Reviews.Title: “Okay hotel that's very convenient”
Reviews.Author: WTEA
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very convenient. About 5-10 minutes walking distance from the Central Station (train) - when you get out of the main entrance, walk to your right. Centrally located to various sites all within walking distance - 15+ minutes to the RL District, 20+ minutes to Dam Sq, etc. The rooms were somewhat small and so were the bathrooms. The A/C didn't work so well so we had to open the window. Renovations were scheduled to be finished late August but they were ongoing. It was a bit of a nuisance in the morning! Hopefully they're finished by now. Checking doesn't hurt! We skipped on the breakfast as you could just walk across the Street to the cafes or even pop in to the train station. Overall, I would say that the Ibis Amsterdam Centre is okay and convenient for a short stay. This is a tourist class hotel so don't expect much. Happy traveling!

Reviews.Title: “Errr... it was OK!”
Reviews.Author: Bondess007GAL
Reviews.Content: Well, it's great if you want a place to sleep and thats about it as it's right next to the train station, which was great for us as we had to get the train from the airport. It was being renovated which we already knew about and boy does it need a make over. Not a brilliant place to stay. It has the essencials but thats about it. A bed, toilet, shower was ok. The breakfast they offered as the restaurant was out of bounds was totally weird and horrible. Some ham, cheese, bread, coffee and orange juice. No facility to toast your bread. Weird!! Don't stay there if you want a decent place to stay. Good for a weekend with a big group where all you need to do is sleep there. I'd say it definatly wasn't worth Â£100 a night!!!

Reviews.Title: “Stayed here 7 times in a row”
Reviews.Author: Pseuds
Reviews.Content: Ideal for short stays in the area. Very close to Cental Station therefore always easy to find with no need to use taxis. Have used plenty of other hotels locally, but always seem to end up going back to the Ibis. Down side is that the restaurant and bar are under refurbishment at the moment but should be ready when we return in November. Also can be noisy - trains, cars, construction work, etc. Staff are friendly and helpful, although check-in/out can be slow at peak times.

Reviews.Title: “We loved the Ibis!”
Reviews.Author: porkiepine
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel about 4 hours before check in and as we were going to a festival all day the staff allowed us to leave our luggage in a locked room which only they have a key for. We eventually checked in around 11.30pm and were seen to immediately with a very efficient service. The room was immaculate and lovely and cool, the bed was enormous. The water pressure in the shower was excellent, which was especially impressive as we were on the top floor! The hotel was very close to the centre of Amsterdam and the train station and therefore very convenient. Slight downside was the lack of restaurant/bar but we were informed of this by our travel agent when booking and we were perfectly happy about this. Breakfast was the only meal included and the hotel provided a continental style breakfast on each floor each morning, whilst this wasn't anything special it was nice of them to offer this facility. Overall I think that the Ibis is a wonderful little city centre hotel, perfect for a short trip to Amsterdam and whilst the hotel is undergoing renovation, they are doing this to improve the hotel for the guests and are trying to make the in between time as easy as possilbe.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: InQueens26
Reviews.Content: This hotel was nice. We chose it because it was literally steps from the Central Station. I can not imagine of you take the train and stay at another hotel you would literally have to do a haul to get to your location, but this hotel on the other hand was right there. About the renovations: yes there was something going on in front of the hotel and i did not hear a word and I was on the second floor facing the part with the construction. The room was small but I think most are like that in Amsterdam. It was very average but had all the necesities. And everything worked fine, TV, towels, air, etc. were fine. Amsterdam hotels in prime locations are very limited and expensive, I think this place is a good compromise. And not to mention all the trains and trams are steps away. Upon check in we also recieved complimentary umbrellas that were green and had tulips on the handel. Very Cute, but luckily we did not need them at all, the weather was amazing. Our two beds were seperate and we did not have much room but it was ok, we also got complimentary breakfast. Overall if I went back to Amsterdam I would try to see if I could get a better hotel for the same price but would not be upset if I had to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant weekend getaway”
Reviews.Author: Jason_Cathy
Reviews.Content: Fab place for couples. Think offers a range of options, can do romatic getaway, cheeky weekend or relaxing break. We just had so much fun and would go back again and again. We stayed at the Ibis hotel near the train station - this is a good location (not far to the grasshopper) and good value. Dont go with a plan - just wander!!!

Reviews.Title: “Best for Tourists”
Reviews.Author: IntlSalesGuy
Reviews.Content: Location, location, location. This property is within walking distance to most sights. It's right next to the Amsterdam Central station, which takes you just about anywhere in the Netherlands, including to/from the airport. The rooms are very small and limited, but clean and decent for short stays. The bathroom is even smaller, so don't expect anything nice. The staff is friendly and helpful and can speak many languages. They have a special luggage room where you can keep your bags there after you check- out if you want to do some afternoon sightseeing. Great hotel for tourists. Otherwise there are nicer hotels in the area if you have the money to spend.

Reviews.Title: “Average Basic Accommodation but central”
Reviews.Author: vond1
Reviews.Content: Booked through DFDS, hotel is very central and is clean and comfortable, the rooms are small and basic but for its price range its good. Downside is very long check in queues but staff speak english and you can check in early and leave luggage for pick up later. Would stay here again as when visiting a city , you are their to see city not spend all day in a hotel room. For a bughet hotel it is well worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “OK but with some problems”
Reviews.Author: Joanna R
Reviews.Content: When I visited it was under renovation and expansion so there where some problems related to that. This renovation is going to carry on all the way through May 2008 as the front desk informed. The problems related to that were: 1. Breakfast was served on each floor in the elevator waiting area, which meant that there were only beverages, bread butter and marmalade. 2. Construction work started at 07:00 so if your not an early bird you will be disturbed. Other then that, the location is great as far as connectivity is concerned and it is in the center. It is quite noisy so the window should remain closed. All staff were polite and helpful. The rooms were not that clean as I found used soap in the shower from a previous customer so I was concerned about bathroom cleanliness. The furniture was newly renovated, but the pillows were so big and bouncy it was annoying. The TV had terrible reception so you couldn't really enjoy anything. The rest of the hotel area was not renovated (old carpet and lighting fixtures) so I am not sure if it was in the schedule to be done or not.

Reviews.Title: “what a dump in the process of renovation”
Reviews.Author: Lord_Blackadder
Reviews.Content: Seemed convenient, but in the start of renovation. Dinning room closed, breakfast is a bread roll and jam provided at the end of a corridor. Hammering on the concrete starts at 6:30 am. Was asked for a 50euro deposit on the room in case I stole anything (says something about the quality of clientel) Tiny room, far better hotels available than this available in Amsterdam for same price

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money.”
Reviews.Author: ancinimancini
Reviews.Content: Second time I chose Ibis mainly because of its location and price. Amsterdam is a very expensive city when it comes to accomodation. Ibis can be found for â‚¬ 100 breakfast included and that is a good deal for Amsterdam. Yes, the bathrooms are small, yes it may e a bit on the noisy side but I can tell you two things...if you are in Amsterdam you don't want to spend your time in the bathroom except when nature calls, and the second thing is if you want peace and quiet go to Santorini in November and not Amsterdam! Enjoy it!

Reviews.Title: “great location but noisy”
Reviews.Author: paul(uk)Manchester
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on the 28/12/2007 Firstly great location next to the train station, great staff, clean hotel and close to the tourist sites but........... The rooms are very compact and the bathrooms are really small. The taxis que up along the front of the hotel with a chap blowing a whistle to direct them into the station until the early hours!!! Hotel is not particually cheap either Stay here with the above in mind!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location but small rooms”
Reviews.Author: koshitek99
Reviews.Content: My friend and I booked this hotel for our weekend getaway in Amsterdam. The reception staff was quite helpful. When we asked them whether the Heineken experience was opened, they went online and checked for us right away. The room is a bit too small and the bathroom is small as well. My friend and I are girls but we still find the bathroom to be quite small. Breakfast was ok. The hotel is under renovation so the breakfast room was closed. They served their "buffet" right by the lifts instead (on every floor). The temperature in the room was a bit too warm. We tried to leave our window opened but we would hear this eerie wind-blowing noise seeping through if we left our windows opened. Also since the back of the hotel faces the train station, we could hear the train entering the platform when we left our windows opened. It could be very noisy. This hotel is great for its location (about 3 min walk from the train station - you will see it on your right once you leave the station) and it is quite clean! That's about it. I find it to be quite pricey.

Reviews.Title: “Very small room”
Reviews.Author: Andrea327
Reviews.Content: Our reservation some how got screwed up and it was not in the system at all. But luckily we got a room when they had just told an Asian couple that they didnâ€™t have any rooms available. Our room had two twin beds in a very very small room. I had to turn sideways on the toilet to fit. Bring your own hair dryer, shampoo, conditioner, lotion, etc because the first day we only got two small bars of soap and the second day we got a bottle of shampoo. You can buy all the toiletries you need in the lobby, but they are pretty costly. I think you can also borrow their hair dryer for a 20 euro deposit. There was no A/C, but we just opened the window since it was cool outside. It was a little loud though since the big bicycle parking garage is right across the street and the train station is right behind you. Anyway, good hotel and nice staff for being right next to the train station.

Reviews.Title: “Needs refurbishment”
Reviews.Author: DoctorToxic
Reviews.Content: Tired, dated, cramped & noisy: more like a student hall of residence than a 3* hotel. Location is great though - close to the station & city centre. The staff are excellent & were very apologetic when I requested a room change due to a strong smell of cigarette smoke (this is a non-smoking hotel, with signs everywhere reminding you of this: I hope the person staying in the room before me got the E50 surcharge). Breakfast is OK. The hotel will be closed from next week (I think) for a long overdue refurbishment - it may well be worth staying here when they reopen.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy and unpleasant”
Reviews.Author: travellerim
Reviews.Content: The rooms are noisy as they face either the central trains station or a main road. The rooms are small and charmless and the bathroom is really small- you have to be quite agile in order to manouvre between a wall and the sink so as to reach the toilet. Breakfast is served at a street level room with glass wall facing a bicycle rack (same view applies also to the first floor). it is dark and unpleasant. The hotel has no proper restaurant, it is only possible to order a take away pizza which you have to go and collect from the bar.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: Gamecock93
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel in June of 2006. This Ibis is about a 1 minute walk from the central Amsterdam train station and tram lines. It is an ideal base for exploring Amsterdam. You can take the train direct from the Airport and be checked in within 30 minutes of clearing customs/immigration. The room was typical Ibis: Very small, tiny TV, average bathroom, limited services, a great value for the price. The room was extremely clean. I would recommend it to anyone who plans to spend the majority of their time exploring the city and doesn't need luxury.

Reviews.Title: “Basic but handy”
Reviews.Author: CosmoKramer2
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for one night purely because we arrived by train from the airport and didn't have much time to change and attend a meeting. The hotel itself is almost part of the station. Just exit the main entrance and walk right for a few minutes past the taxi rank. This obviously means train noises can be quite loud inside of the rooms. The rooms are typical Ibis, small / basic but clean. I would not stay here longer than one night though. There is another Ibis hotel in Amsterdam within a 15 minute taxi ride from the station, apparently this hotel is more modern and rooms are slightly bigger.
